### Past Achievements and Challenges
[![firstactivationcycle.png](https://i.postimg.cc/mhxpG4P1/firstactivationcycle.png)](https://postimg.cc/V0RWj3Bz)
[![secondactivationcycle.png](https://i.postimg.cc/3Rcbnm7B/secondactivationcycle.png)](https://postimg.cc/YGQ3S4vG)


- **First Activation Cycle (GG20):** Focused on initial community building and establishing our regenerative goals. We onboarded several projects to the network, with four participating in the GreenPill community funding round with Octant.
- **Second Activation Cycle (GG21):** We aimed to align objectives, deepen regenerative campaigns, enhance partnerships, and expand educational efforts.
  - **Community Alignment:** We refined our goals but lost some members during this process.
  - **Regenerative Campaigns:** Successfully deepened our efforts in biodiversity projects and waste management.
  - **Partnerships:** Consolidated existing partnerships and created new ones, including with AgroforestDAO, NodeHubWeb3, and FabulosaLab.
  - **Education:** Developed an onboarding document and facilitated sessions, including one Greenpilled session about grassroots economics and the Sarafu Network's work in Kenya.
  - **Quadratic Funding Round:** While we did not advance much in this area, we aim to conduct this round on Celo by the end of 2024, tied to our training cohort participants. This cohort is being created in partnership with AgroforestDAO.

### Our Team
- **[Coi - Community Lead](https://https://x.com/caue_tomaz):** An agroecologist fostering community engagement and education.
- **[Athus - Tech Lead](https://https://x.com/Atskotzen):** A full-stack developer driving our technological innovations.
- **[MaMurf - Biodiversity Data Scientist](https://https://www.linkedin.com/in/marina-furlan-giubbina-029b0829a/):** PHD specializing in biodiversity data and impact analysis.
- **[Deroila - Community Healer](https://https://www.linkedin.com/in/deroila-vm-793102a5/):** A spiritual environmentalist focusing on community wellness.
- **[Vini Glocal - Regen Netweaver](https://https://x.com/VRSS):** An open-source dinosaur and co-creator of the ReRe protocol, with a background in the cypherpunk movement. He developed documentation on hosting, onboarding, and facilitation, promoting the concept of "Unboarding" to shift away from traditional speculative value paradigms in Web3.
- **[AgothA - Storyteller](https://https://x.com/ZonaEcco):** A word mage creating compelling narratives for our initiatives.
- **[Diogo Jorge - Strategic Advisor](https://https://x.com/agroforestDAO):** A cyber-agroforester providing strategic guidance.
- **[Alan - Master Educator](https://https://x.com/pretoweb3):** Designing our internal journeys and protocols.
- **[Ademir - Regenerative Agent](https://https://x.com/cand89830):** Leading and engaging the local community.
- **[Thalles - Regenerative Agent](https://https://x.com/ThalesTarza420):** Leading the campaign to create native bee habitats.

#### Coordinated Impact Protocol (CIP) for Regeneration
GreenPill Brasil employs a Coordinated Impact Protocol (CIP) to systematically address and manage regenerative campaigns. This structured approach ensures that our efforts are well-organized, impactful, and measurable.

### Observation, Registration, and Mapping (ORM)
- **Description:** Identify and map areas needing regenerative intervention.
- **Actions:** Use GIS tools and field techniques to recognize and document areas dominated by invasive species.
- **Documentation:** Broad view photos and detailed images of invasive species.



### Research Analysis and Verification (RAV)
- **Description:** Analyze recorded information and validate proposed actions.
- **Actions:** Evaluate field data, identify priority intervention areas, and validate findings with experts.
- **Documentation:** Assessment reports and validation documentation.

### Engagement, Interaction, and Execution (EIE)
- **Description:** Implement regenerative actions and confirm their execution.
- **Actions:** Carry out cutting, shredding, and planting native species; monitor and document progress.
- **Documentation:** Photos of planting processes and improvements in soil health.

## [Ongoing Regenerative Campaigns](https://https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/edit?mid=1PqwEKw-wvhY73M85qAy56qHHBXWeSBA&usp=sharing)
- **Control of Leucaena leucocephala:**
  - **Area:** More than 20 protected areas dominated by Leucaena to be controled.
  - **Actions:** Cutting and shredding Leucaena, planting native seedlings.
- **Impact:** Approximately 100m¬≤ controlled area, 25 native trees on the ground.

[![Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-203420.png](https://i.postimg.cc/V6qWbtvv/Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-203420.png)](https://postimg.cc/MMGQCvyJ)
[![Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-203523.png](https://i.postimg.cc/Dfccv1RY/Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-203523.png)](https://postimg.cc/ThpbQ5dr)
[![Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-203830.png](https://i.postimg.cc/FFPJCpMm/Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-203830.png)](https://postimg.cc/w3mv7Xxb)
[![Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-203721.png](https://i.postimg.cc/BnFL60XQ/Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-203721.png)](https://postimg.cc/NKgfJZ6W)
[![Whats-App-Image-2024-08-02-at-20-43-06.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/RFhvW7XQ/Whats-App-Image-2024-08-02-at-20-43-06.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/kV00ZbrB)



- **Native Bee Conservation:**
  - **Activities:** Distributed over 50 native bee traps on S√£o Paulo state and transferred captured colonies to proper wooden boxes.
  - **Impact:** Improved pollination of native plants and increased biodiversity.

[![Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-204622.png](https://i.postimg.cc/d1ZtWRrQ/Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-204622.png)](https://postimg.cc/9RVh07Ls)
[![Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-204639.png](https://i.postimg.cc/RVLCbZ6t/Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-204639.png)](https://postimg.cc/sv1RMyJf)
[![Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-204712.png](https://i.postimg.cc/pd4Pn97w/Captura-de-tela-2024-08-02-204712.png)](https://postimg.cc/94d66fcb)



- **Recycling and Composting Initiatives:**
  - **Composting:** Produced 300L of organic compost and spread it on the soil, enhancing soil fertility.

[![Whats-App-Image-2024-06-17-at-20-52-34.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/vmV5nnT9/Whats-App-Image-2024-06-17-at-20-52-34.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/5HfHd6wN)

  - **Recycling Support:** Mapped and supported 10 recyclable waste collectors, providing organic food or financial aid bi-weekly.

[![Whats-App-Image-2024-06-19-at-16-15-00.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/8c1vxnHB/Whats-App-Image-2024-06-19-at-16-15-00.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/wyG3m2n7)
[![Whats-App-Image-2024-06-19-at-16-14-56.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/YSYm0wDz/Whats-App-Image-2024-06-19-at-16-14-56.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/5H9tKDVX)

### Strategic Partnerships and Collaborations
- **AgroforestDAO:** Training cohort for agroforestry projects.
- **Silviprotocol:** Developing an open-source tree database and the GreenGoods app, aiming to create a replicable model for other regions and species.
- **Towards Symbiocracy (Zuzalu):** Exploring hypercerts and the CELO ecosystem, [see registers](https://hackmd.io/EVUQj_UWQx-RKnwaK-9LHw?view).
- **ICP:** Exploring hypercerts and decentralized AI models. [See records](https://github.com/DeAIWorkingGroupInternetComputer/DeAIWorkingGroupInternetComputer/tree/main/WorkingGroupMeetings/2024.07.25)
- **NodeHubWeb3:** Providing infrastructure for events, workshops, classes, and podcast studio under the ReRe cultural protocol.
- **FabulosaLab:** A maker space in Rio de Janeiro that hosted a [climate awareness event](https://hub.greenpill.network/t/regen-meetup-greenpill-brazil-fabulosa-lab-innovating-for-climate-resilience/48/3) and launched our campaign to help RS.
- **Celo Network Support:** GreenPill Brasil is providing technical support for developing a Celo network node in Rio de Janeiro, in partnership with NodeHubWeb3 and ReRe.

### Events and Engagements
- **ETHSamba, Rio OnChain Week and ETHRio:** Strengthened network and innovation.
- **Community Meetings:** 100+ meetings, 150+ hours of discussions.

[![17721443-654f-4ef3-8179-83b2e0080b46.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/PxW0rPkz/17721443-654f-4ef3-8179-83b2e0080b46.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/r0pffysK)

### Environmental Data Science
Our campaigns integrate robust data science methodologies to monitor and evaluate environmental impacts:
- **Baseline Assessments:** Partnering with biologists and ecologists for species inventories and chromatographic analysis to track ecosystem improvements above and below ground.
- **Quarterly Monitoring:** Regular assessments of biodiversity and soil health.
- **Data-Driven Insights:** Preparing publications on native bees, invasive species costs, and biodiversity data quality.

## GreenPill Brasil Roadmap - Q3 2024

### July - September 2024

**Community Engagement and Education**
- Host onboarding workshops and educational sessions to integrate new members.
- Launch new Greenpilled sessions focused on various regenerative finance topics.
- Continue hosting bi-weekly community meetings and interactive workshops.
- Expand educational content and resources for community members.

**Regenerative Campaigns**
- Initiate the training cohort for agroforestry projects in partnership with AgroforestDAO.
- Increase activities for controlling invasive species, including distribution of native bee traps and facilitating colony transfers.
- Continue the control and shredding of Leucaena leucocephala, and plant more native seedlings.
- Increase composting efforts.

**Technological Integration**
- Mint and distribute hypercerts to document and reward regenerative actions.
- Conduct a technical workshop on the use of blockchain for impact tracking.
- Implement a pilot project using decentralized AI models from ICP for environmental data analysis.
- Finalize the MVP of GreenGoods in partnership with the GreenPill Dev Guild.

**Strategic Partnerships**
- Strengthen collaboration with NodeHubWeb3 and FabulosaLab for upcoming events.
- Finalize plans for the first Quadratic Funding round in partnership with AgroforestDAO.
- Organize a joint event with NodeHubWeb3 to promote the Celo network node development.
- Strengthen partnership with Silviprotocol by participating in Operations Web3.

## GreenPill Brasil Roadmap - Q4 2024

### October - December 2024

**Community Engagement and Education**
- Review and assess the onboarding and educational initiatives.
- Publish the first scientific article on the outcomes of the Greenpilled sessions.
- Continue hosting community meetings and expanding educational content.

**Regenerative Campaigns**
- Launch the first Quadratic Funding round on Celo for agroforestry projects.
- Map and support additional recyclable waste collectors.
- Continue the control and shredding of Leucaena leucocephala, and plant more native seedlings.
- Scale up composting and waste management efforts.

**Technological Integration**
- Mint and distribute final hypercerts for this period.
- Assess the impact and efficiency of blockchain and hypercerts used in campaigns.
- Implement further improvements to the GreenGoods app based on user feedback.

**Strategic Partnerships**
- Continue collaboration with FabulosaLab, hosting another climate awareness event.
- Strengthen the partnership with Silviprotocol in operations Web3
-  Work with the dev guild for the GreenGoods MVP launch.
- Provide technical support for the Celo network node in Rio de Janeiro, in partnership with NodeHubWeb3 and ReRe.



### Join Our Mission
GreenPill Brasil invites everyone to join our mission. Whether you're involved in Web3 or passionate about environmental conservation, there's a place for you in our community. Together, we can make a significant impact.

Stay tuned, engage, and transform.

[Connect with us on Telegram GreenPill Brasil](https://t.me/greenpillbrasil)

metadata.title: GreenPill Brasil - GG23
metadata.description:
# **Greenpill Brasil: Catalyzing Regeneration Through Web3 Innovation** 
---
At Greenpill Brasil, we're pioneering regenerative finance (ReFi) and ecological restoration by seamlessly blending cutting-edge Web3 technologies with grassroots action. Our community-driven approach focuses on regenerating ecosystems, empowering local communities, and creating resilient economic systems.

[![Captura-de-tela-de-2025-04-02-02-24-54.png](https://i.postimg.cc/xCSJVN05/Captura-de-tela-de-2025-04-02-02-24-54.png)](https://postimg.cc/R3XVcFJJ)
---
## Why Web3?
Web3 technology is fundamental to our mission due to its transparency, traceability, and decentralization. By harnessing blockchain, we:
- Empower communities to transparently control their funding and resources.
- Ensure auditable processes and trust among stakeholders.
- Innovate through decentralized governance to effectively coordinate and scale regenerative initiatives.

[![5105036607093846059.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/k4x0Bv1R/5105036607093846059.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/BLnYzHGJ)
---
## Key Activities - See our [KarmaGAP](https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/greenpill-brasil?tab=updates)

Our recent key initiatives include the [**II AgroforestDAO Journey**](https://x.com/agroforestDAO/status/1900009504625787367), focusing on agroecological restoration; the pioneering [**Regen Rio de Janeiro** program](https://x.com/greenpillbrasil/status/1906224485050527808), allocating $25,000 for impactful local projects; and the development of a comprehensive [**Climate Megazord**](https://www.canva.com/design/DAGYTqqLdlA/5iEk5mpI4k1jAkVh2NhxsA/view?utm_content=DAGYTqqLdlA&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=uniquelinks&utlId=h6f2da95b9b) for climate resilience coordination.

[![JA2.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/hGnbK8d5/JA2.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/3kLDBv9X)

- **Community Building & Education:** Host weekly community meetings and interactive Web3 workshops that reframe traditional onboarding as ‚Äúunboarding,‚Äù focusing on empathetic hosting and peer-to-peer facilitation on ReFi and Web3. See in [Web3 Fundraising Workshop].(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yliIDHHVr8U): Hybrid session introducing nonprofits to the Regen Rio de Janeiro program and practical steps for Quadratic Funding.
- **Quadratic Funding Rounds:** [**Regen Rio de Janeiro**](https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/42220/30) allocating $25k, and the **I AgroforestDAO Round and Contributors**, mobilizing community funding for regenerative projects.
- **Environmental Restoration:** Active ecological restoration through invasive species control, native bee habitat creation, agroforestry initiatives, and practical events such as [SAF do Futuro](https://app.charmverse.io/greenpillbrasil/page-04310287844933702), which provided tools and food to participants.
- **Decentralized Governance:** Utilizing [Charmverse](https://app.charmverse.io/greenpillbrasil/proposals) for direct resource proposals and [Gardens v2](https://app.gardens.fund/gardens/137/0x6fac69b92b1943da2a8ff99e3687451f10066018/0x65bf57a410ed5fa69669f307c2da65eae06279f4) for strategic, macro-level resource allocation.
- **Climate Coordination:** Implementing the [Climate Megazord](https://www.canva.com/design/DAGYTqqLdlA/5iEk5mpI4k1jAkVh2NhxsA/view?utm_content=DAGYTqqLdlA&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=uniquelinks&utlId=h6f2da95b9b) a protocol focused in predictability, response and adaptation using AI, IoT, and blockchain for effective climate resilience.
- **Recognition with Hypercerts:** Minting [Hypercerts](https://app.hypercerts.org/hypercerts/42220-0x16bA53B74c234C870c61EFC04cD418B8f2865959-25861459885991323223216470164814384070656) to transparently document and reward regenerative contributions.
- **GreenGoods Testing:** Conducted in partnership with the Greenpill Dev Guild, featuring new plant identification capabilities integrated into the app workflow.
- **Addressing Data Bias:** Actively developing a proposal to address biases in environmental data, improving the quality and reliability of biodiversity insights. [Read the full research proposal here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1P4vAUC9w1JthZCWt3IjUsq67XB8CKI-PRk61jo4yn3g/edit?usp=sharing).
-  [Direct Support to build a Living Center](https://x.com/greenpillbrasil/status/1906211708101660769) - Community Hub: In Tijuca, Rio de Janeiro, we successfully completed the first phase of our ambitious Living Center project. This multifunctional hub integrates education, agroecology, and cultural activities under one roof, strengthening community resilience and enabling practical learning experiences for sustainable living.
[![cpp1.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/KYN03p7T/cpp1.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/p9mfgZ6V)

## Outcomes & Metrics
- **Educational Reach:** Over 100 sessions conducted with 700+ hours of community engagement.
- **Environmental Impact:** Mapped 20+ protected areas; sequestered 300+ kg of carbon, supported 6 Regen Events, 50+ native bee traps distributed, 150+ native trees planted.
- **Community Growth:** 100+ Web3 wallets onboarded.
- **Governance Transparency:** Over 20 proposals reviewed with active community governance participation.
- **Financial Transparency:** More than US$30,000 transparently allocated to impactful projects through decentralized mechanisms.
---
## Current Organizational Structure
GreenPill Brasil's governance model schema

- **Self-elected Council:** Strategic oversight and governance settings.
- **Stewards:** Guardians of the mission, overseeing treasury and proposals.
- **Operations:** Proposal management, event hosting, and ecological project execution.
- **Resource Mobilization:** Acquisition of funding through Web3 platforms and partnerships.
- **Management & Administration:** Effective management of projects and community resources.
- **Community:** Active engagement, moderation, and educational outreach.
- **Collaboration:** Strategic partnerships to enhance impact and scalability.

[![mermaid-diagram-2025-04-02-015600.png](https://i.postimg.cc/HkrbB37q/mermaid-diagram-2025-04-02-015600.png)](https://postimg.cc/FYQfKypp)
---
## 2025 Strategic Focus: Consolidating Coordination Infrastructure

GreenPill Brasil has successfully completed its first chapter: raising awareness, onboarding hundreds of new contributors, and becoming a reference point in Brazil for building regenerative ecosystems powered by Web3 tools. We‚Äôve catalyzed a growing movement around regenerative finance (ReFi) and community-based coordination. Now, we enter a new phase.

In 2025, our core focus is **consolidating the infrastructure for decentralized coordination**. This proposal is part of a broader, interconnected effort to strengthen the systems that will sustain and scale regenerative action.

### Cookie Jar Coordination Layer on Celo

[![Captura-de-tela-de-2025-04-02-02-22-21.png](https://i.postimg.cc/vHC52kwW/Captura-de-tela-de-2025-04-02-02-22-21.png)](https://postimg.cc/4mbKm8dd)

We are co-developing a coordination mechanism using [Cookie Jar](https://github.com/HoomanDigital/cookie-jar/blob/main/contract/cookie%20jar-withblacklist.sol) contracts [deployed on the Celo blockchain](https://celo-alfajores.blockscout.com/address/0xD54799973e5e8f468A6DF910C53514aeDF9D4868?tab=logs). This is work is part of a collaborative [research model proposal within the **Allo Capital** community](https://research.allo.capital/t/decentralized-research-funding-using-cookie-jar/122), and a collaboration between the **Greenpill Dev Guild** and **Celo Europe**. It aims to bring **transparent micro-granting infrastructure** to our community, using ERC-20 compatible tokens like cREAL.

We‚Äôre currently exploring and implementing two Cookie Jars:
- One for the **GreenPill Brasil Council** (our main governance body).
- One for the **Guardians** (our distributed community stewards).

These Jars will serve as onchain grant pools that reward verified regenerative contributions, reinforce autonomy in coordination, and support distributed decision-making.

### Climate Megazord Coordination via Gardens

In parallel, we are consolidating our [Climate Megazord](https://www.canva.com/design/DAGYTqqLdlA/5iEk5mpI4k1jAkVh2NhxsA/view?utm_content=DAGYTqqLdlA&utm_campaign=designshare&utm_medium=link2&utm_source=uniquelinks&utlId=h6f2da95b9b) as our long-term climate resilience protocol. It follows three pillars:
- **Prediction** (early signals and local climate data).
- **Adaptation** (community infrastructure and preparedness).
- **Response** (coordinated action during disasters).

Governance and resource allocation for this protocol is coordinated via [Gardens v2](https://app.gardens.fund/gardens/137/0x6fac69b92b1943da2a8ff99e3687451f10066018/0x65bf57a410ed5fa69669f307c2da65eae06279f4), using signaling and conviction voting mechanisms.

### Glocalism Collaboration

Our alliances span from local agroecology task forces (e.g. SAF do Futuro, Morro da Reden√ß√£o) to the global Ethereum Localism movement and ecosystem allies like Celo and Gitcoin. GreenPill Brasil is committed to being a bridge between grassroots regeneration and resilient coordination tech.
---
## How the Funds Will Be Used

This new phase is about **laying the groundwork for long-term regeneration** by creating the digital infrastructure that empowers communities, codifies trust, and fuels decentralized action.

The requested funds for this cycle will be focused on:
- **Deploying and operationalizing two Cookie Jars** for internal micro-funding coordination (Council & Guardians).
- **Coordinating and documenting the Climate Megazord infrastructure**, including governance cycles on Gardens.
- **Sustaining direct funding for grassroots regen activities** via [Charmverse proposals](https://app.charmverse.io/greenpillbrasil/proposals) under our Regen Incentives campaign.
- **Scale our onboarding and funding processes** to support more projects and regional nodes.
- **Refine our decentralized protocols**, integrating tools like [Impact Miner](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.company.atlantis&hl=pt_BR&pli=1), and the evolving [GreenGoods app](https://greengoods.app) (with new in-app plant ID features).
- **Expand partnerships** with AgroforestDAO, Fabulosa Lab, Celo Public Goods, Celo Europe, and others to co-create more inclusive and impactful regenerative ecosystems.
---
## **Join Us in Building a Future**

GreenPill Brasil is not just a project‚Äîit‚Äôs a movement. Your support will help us build a infrastructure that scales trust, amplifies grassroots agency, and coordinates regenerative action across Brazil and beyond.

[telegram](https://t.me/+6GlufLobfMRiMTIx)

**Let‚Äôs regenerate, one step at a time.** 

[![Gpbr-climate-megazord-1.png](https://i.postimg.cc/90LYfY0C/Gpbr-climate-megazord-1.png)](https://postimg.cc/kRtb18Wp)

project.title: Endangered Tokens: NRWA Tokenization - Invest in nature's scarcest resources
project.description:
--- 
Help us register and verify ENTS: Monumental, endangered and ancient Trees. The scarce treasures of the forests. Let's build a new economy backed by these assets proof of being preserved. 


**Endangered Tokens** is a ReFi dMRV & NFT community looking to revalue biodiversity and **incentivize regeneration** by tokenizing endangered & monumental trees with **web3 preserve&earn incentives** and digital value added with content, technology and **real world impact**.

![](https://i.imgur.com/d48BuYn.png)


**TLDR: What's new since the Last round (GG20)?**

-EntSnap, the tree verification dapp, on alpha testing stage. Extended until August 31st. More than 100 trees verified and more than 20 users onboarded.
-Participation on Ethereum Chile 2024, Regenerative Finance talk given.
-Participation in 2 more community events onboarding users to our dApp
-$ROOTS Delayed token launch due to improving tokenomics and best token engineering practices. 
-UX/UI improvement of the Entsnap dApp. Still on development. 
-WebApp backoffice for Entsnap Data validation v1.0
-Webapp for tree tokenization from Entsnap Data in development
-We are sorry to have suffered the death of a dear friend of our team members, advisor and supporter, Cristobal Ostornol, who drowned on July 17th snorkeling with us, we couldn't save him. This event was devastating to our team and was a setback to our goals of this round. Our sincere apologies to our supporters and we ask for prayers.




**Roadmap for this round (GG21):**
- Onboard 100+ users to Entsnap Tree dmrv dapp
- Decentralized tree tokenization web platform Beta from Entsnap Data
- Launch Entsnap Open Beta 
- Register 500+ trees with Entsnap
- Launch Ents Wiki to inform about Endangered Trees to focus on registering
- Improve AI recognition Models for Entsnap verification system
- ENTS DAO Governance mechanism design
- ENTS Foundation LLC incorporated in Arizona


# Why support us?

*Problem to Solve*

**Endangered trees** are responsible for maintaining the health of most of the world's **endangered forest ecosystems**, but rarely produce relevant revenue for landowners (without being damaged) and even become **financial liabilities**, thus encouraging their ilegal felling. 



*Endangered Tokens‚Äô Solution*

**Leverage web3**, **dMRV** and **digital art** to incentivize the protection of these **scarce** beings by changing their status from merely the cost of maintaining a tree to a **revenue producing Bio-Asset**. Using NFTs ERC-721 we tokenize trees through imaging and georeferencing becoming pioneers in the tokenization of Natural Real World Assets (NRWA)


## Missions

1.-To **foster the protection** of endangered trees by bestowing them with **tangible value** in society.

2.-Form a **decentralized** investment community for biodiversity preservation, giving value and governance to stakeholders through **Crypto Assets**.
## Vision 

As humans we need to **revalue biodiversity** and living ecosystems through the preservation of Endangered Species, which are **invaluable natural assets** to society.
We envision a world where endangered and long lived trees are **not only preserved** but also revered for their **intrinsic value**, fostering a harmonious **coexistence** between **nature and society**.
 

---
### How will we accomplish this?


![](https://i.imgur.com/laF4AmK.png) 




**Endangered Tokens** is a **ReFi & DeSci NFT** community looking to revalue biodiversity by **tokenizing georeferenced endangered trees**. We are building a **real life impact** coordination game in which users can receive rewards for verifying georreferenced trees with their phones. Each specimen is characterized and photographed alongside a small verse description, and when owning one, you **become the godfather of a scarce endangered tree**!
With the funds raised we will help landowners finance the **protection of endangered Forest** with **reforestation**, verification of **carbon credits** from the forests and the creation of quality **digital content & data** to add value to the tokens, content like:

* **Georeferenced images and interactive mapping**, Taken through our Entsnap dApp in a decentralized way and available publicly.
* **Inmersive UX for ReFi Assets**, to engage with web3 enthusiasts and show the value of each token **as seen in real life**.
* **3D tourism experience** of the protected forests thus **reducing the footprint** of real life tourism while also generating a continuous flow of revenue to **keep supporting the protection of the forests**. 
* Using the 3D replicas of each tree as a virtual asset for **video games** and/or **augmented reality** experiences
* **Recording data** from the forest for research and enhanced digital experiences like music from the frequencies of the trees, **bioacoustics**, video recording of the ecosystems, **climate data**, water flow, among other relevant information.


NFT holders will receive a portion of the revenue that will come from the NFT Sales, tourism experiences, data management and carbon credits, thus converting endangered trees from liabilities to ***biodiversity assets for the future***. 

We are also developing a new type of Credit Class for Old Grown Trees (OGT credit Class) so any type of big tree can become a way of proving your positive impact in the world and a way of financing its protection, instead of cutting them down for wood.

---

### Which kind of trees are we talking about?

We are currently working in **Chile** in South america, with the rare species [***Gomortega Keule***](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gomortega), or locally known as Queule. This magnificent beings are the last one of the *Gomortegacae* Family, dating its evolution to ***Pangea*** times. It is estimated that there are no more than 4000 specimens alive in the world! (*Scarcer than Bitcoin!*)


![](https://i.imgur.com/YsQ5Heb.jpg)


With the help of past Gitcoin Grants we are also making contacts and reviewing possible projects with the Brazilian Tree **"Pau Brasil" or [Paubrasilia echinata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paubrasilia)** an endangered Species of tree from which the country got it's name! The heavily abused lumbering by portuguese conquerors depleted their population and nowadays is a rare and unique living being. 

We are developing a roadmap of species to keep onboarding, like Alerce, Pitao, Araucaria, Baobab, Sequoia, and others. 

---

### How will grant funding has been/will be spent?

As of the date of this 21th round of Gitcoin Grants (#GG21 #letsgrow) we have raised around 38000 DAI through Gitcoin that we have spent cautiously in development and growth and also have some saved for our roadmap goals. Without Gitcoin this project would not be able to keep moving forward as we have. We thank every supporter and every sponsor of the Climate Rounds and the Climate Coordination Network Collective for its amazing work! 

Things we have invested until now and will continue to invest: 

**1. Project development** (Priority)

Develop the products, contracts and DAPPs necessary to ensure mission fulfilment, growth and engagement. See ongoing projects for further detail. 



**2. Vital activities core team funding**
- [x] General administration
- [x] Coding and development
- [x] Marketing and community growth
- [x] NGO's and landowners coordination
- [x] Content creation and production


**3. Endangered Tokens Conservation program**

![](https://i.imgur.com/SvRnym7.png)
* Tokenization, extensive cadastre & landowner agreements
* in-situ conservation actions to reduce threats. 
* Ex-situ conservation actions and landscape restoration actions
* Sustainable local development & community engagement
* Research on species and their habitats
* Carbon Bonds verification, trading and retirement

**4. Marketing and community building**

We have realized that a crypto community needs to be active, engaged and in constant growth in order to stay healthy. This is an important pillar of investment on top of a marketing lead within the team. Among other things, we have attended several Crypto Conferences creating network and alliances with important crypto and ReFi Actors. 


**5. Decentralization**

One of the challenges faced has been to improve decentralization within the projects. Part of the funds will go to improve decentralization each round.

**6. Equipment**

In order to experiment, record, experience and iterate on our products we have invested in technology like the Plantsplay device, HD Camera, Meta Oculus Quest 2 and looking to purchase a 360¬∞ action cam for content creation within the forest. 

---

## State of the art & ongoing projects

We have done so far 3 official expeditions to "El Hual-Hual" forest in which we are working on. 



**1st Expedition:** GPS geolocation and audiovisual material for tokenization of 25 Adult Queules. Here a seedling Queule picture from that date

![SeedlingLOW](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rkw441zx0.png)



**2nd Expedition**: Visit the forest with ReFi friend from Koywe

![VisitaHual](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rkdS8JMgA.png)


 **3rd Expedition:** Gather more audiovisual material for detail needs in the 3D modelling of the forest
 
 ![Audiovisual expedition LOW](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Hkwa6kzxR.png)


**4rd Expedition:** Music of the trees through frequency device


![ExpedicionM√∫sicaLOW](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rJXB3AMgA.png)

![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/ee54ec3e61f22bc7787c288ea5109c88/Audiovisual_expedition.PNG)

**5th Expedition:** Big & monumental trees at Lago Caro Patagonia

Through the swamp towards the big forest!
![Entxpedition Lago caro 4](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/H1vXQM2lA.jpg)

A wild big Koywe Patag√≥nico appears!
![Entxpedition Lago caro 2](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/ry3BXz3l0.jpg)


### *The Tokents*: Digital assets with ReFi purpose (NOT INTENDED AS ADVERTISING ONLY AS SHOWING AS A MILESTONE)

* #### Elder ENTS NFT: Georreferenced tokenized Specimens of Endangered Trees. 
    * 1st Collection Gomortega Keule - Elder ENT Queule# : **Founders Collection** 
  * Premium Asset of the community

  * Georreferenced tokenized Specimens of real life Critically Endangered Trees.

  * Digital property percentage of the 3D assets built around each tree. 



  * Eligible for airdrops and voting power (TBD)

  * Contract verified on the polygon mainnet 

  * 25 Queule trees have been tokenized, only 12 Elder Ents Gomortega Keule have been minted.
 
   [**Opensea Site**](https://opensea.io/collection/elder-ents-gomortega-keule)
   
* ## Production and development of the first WEB3 virtual reality touristic *Endangered Forest* experience.

We have been developing this project for almost a year, but got delayed in the middle for lack of funds and other inconvenients. We expect to have the first MVP by september available to be experienced in Meta Oculus Quest 2 or similar. 

*First mock-up video of one of the 3d model replicas of the tokenized trees.*
{%youtube A2Je4vC5g50 %}
![](https://i.imgur.com/X25AXwr.png)

[Youtube video link](https://https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A2Je4vC5g50)

*Advanced 3D model in Unreal Engine 5 of 10 of the 25 tokenized trees.*
![](https://i.imgur.com/bitYCOj.png)

(Check it [Here](https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/elder-ent-queule4-replica-0a6e222a40a0413d97bb58aff7ec47cd) as a 3D model)
(Check [Here](https://sketchfab.com/endangeredtokens/collections/elder-ent-gomortega-keule-replicas-e036fd4082ab412a90251c00c6a513d9) the rest of the models made) 
   

   
   * ###  ENTS DAPP: Decentralized Proof-of-Tree registering & incentives DAPP & Public Registry Map for Endangered Trees and ecosistemic services

One of the challenges we've faced on our journey is to keep updated on-chain data to verify an Endangered tree is actually alive. With decentralization, smartphones and a well designed DAPP we can connect incentives with tasks on the field to discover, register, content capture, tokenize and give living proof-of-tree for valuable specimen, keeping token holders updated on their collected ENTS aswell as landwoners incetivized to preserve them.
(GG19)
![](https://i.imgur.com/y0udaZS.png)
(First Mock-up)


(GG20)
![ENTS DAPP UX.jpg](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkzvC_ump.jpg)
(First Figma for the V1.0 app in development)

(GG21)
![EntsDapp UX](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/B19IsTiKC.png)
(Current Entsnap UX Figma in development)



* ### Entrees NFT: (NOT INTENDED AS ADVERTISING ONLY AS SHOWING AS A MILESTONE)
(Mock-up Only)
  * 1st Collection CryptoKeules - Entrees CK# : **Artist Diegong** - TBM 9990+10(1/1)s 

![](https://i.imgur.com/jFtN92C.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/29hudch.jpg)

1st Minting December 2022 
2nd Mint TBA
This Pixel Art token will grant you access (hence it is and Entry) to the Alpha Release of the Ecosystem UX in development. The purpose of this be able to grow the community further than only the available tokenized Endangered trees (That are really scarce to produce many!)





* ### Old Grown trees Credit Class Development (OGT Credits)

In order to fully convert our protected trees to biodiversity Assets we thought a way to represent them as credits. The OGT Credits system allows landowners to register their Old Grown Trees through the ENTS DAPP, a user-friendly application. Once registered, these trees transform into 'credits' based on their age and conservation status. Landowners can then monetize these credits, creating a compelling economic reason to preserve these trees.

[OGT Credit class document draft - Comments accepted](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1InmHe8GEGo0ZsklMu_GqEmaQutDLny6YXvMnzo0LTX8/edit?usp=sharing)
* #### Ecosystem UX development

For two years we have been thinking the best way to make interact the Endangered Tokens User with their Endangered trees Collectibles. We believe the User Experience can make a difference in the value of a token. Combining previous developments we are on the road to creating a unique experience.

As a player of Ecosystem UX, you can collect and plant rare and georeferenced tokenized trees as NFTs, earn rewards, and interact with other players from around the world. These trees are not just any trees; they are rare and endangered species that need our help to survive. By collecting these trees, players contribute to the conservation of these species, learn about their unique characteristics, and help preserve the biodiversity of our planet.

![](https://i.imgur.com/P4OJ0lj.jpg)
(Mock-up Only)




 ### Fungible Tokens TBD

* ### $ENTS DAO Governance Token - Fungible ERC20 to vote in DAO discussions and other ReFi/DeFi applications- TBA

* ### $ROOTS utility Token - Fungible ERC20 to use within dapp functions and utilities. This Token will be the rewards & payment token within the ENTS DAPP.

 # Projects in development

Other type of collectible to learn about local ecosystems and can be used to enhance your experience within our upcoming platform.

Using Unreal Engine 5 we have modeled so far 10 of the 25 tokenized Queules. The first product that is ready-to-launch from this is the Queule 3D showroom to explore the modeled trees as a virtual experience.

## ‚ò∏Ô∏èüéµüé∂üéµMusic of the ENTSüéµüé∂üéµ

Alongside the virtual experience we are recording the frequencies of the endangered trees through a PlantsPlay device (www.plantsplay.com) as the first approach. Our vision is to be able to stream the music of the endangered trees live, so they can produce their own content to help them stay alive.


![ExpedicionM√∫sicaLOW](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rJXB3AMgA.png)



##  DeSci projects to be developed


#### Dendrochronology of longlivedtrees to understand climate change.

With the proper tools and scientific proffesionals measuring the age of longlived trees and its roots can help us understand more about their endangered situation. 

#### Seed bank for old grown trees as premium genetics.

Big trees that have survived so long represent the best specimens among their species. A seed bank to support its regeneration is vital for fostering their reproduction.

metadata.description:
--- 
Help us register, verify and propagate ENTS: Monumental, endangered and ancient Trees. The scarce treasures of the forests. Let's build a new economy backed by these assets proof of being preserved. 


**Endangered Tokens** is a ReFi dMRV & NFT community looking to revalue biodiversity and **incentivize regeneration** by tokenizing endangered & monumental trees with **web3 preserve&earn incentives** and digital value added with content, technology and **real world impact**.

![](https://i.imgur.com/d48BuYn.png)


### **Location Based Impact:** 
We are making impact in five specific locations within 2 regions of Chile in a direct way:
- **El Hual-Hual Forest:** A private conservation area located in the coastal side of √ëuble Region in Chile. We have tokenized 25 Queules and helped the landowner finance its conservation efforts. 
- **Los Maquis regeneration center:**  Its landowner is looking to regenerate land used for industrial wood harvesting and residential plots. We have planted over 10 Queules plus removed foreign species to let the native forest grow. This round we looking to expand this impact.
- **Alto el Molino private conservation √Årea:** We are working together with "Los Peumos SpA. " to incentivize the protection of a native forest located within a land destined to be plotted for residential use. We looking to protect more than 10000 square meters of land and include Queules and Pitaos as Endangered Species to be positioned within the reserve. 
- **Quebrada Cerrillos:** A private conservation reserve in which we have conversations to start a Endangered Species planting among the different landowners that hold the governance of the reserve. 
- **Escuela Chucao:** A private rural School located in the "Los Lagos" Region in southern Chile, in the middle of the habitat of the Alerce tree (fitzroya Cuprezoides). We Will have a Alerce nursery  run by students, and will teach students about the importance of endangered trees to protect endangered habitats. 

Other locations to integrate: 
We are looking to decentralize the process of onboarding locations to our platform so more landowners can benefit from endangered trees as biodiversity assets. Hopefully with this method scale our location impact model towards a decentralized impact model. 
___

**TLDR: What's new since the Last round (RWBGG21)?**

- EntSnap, the tree verification dapp, on Open Beta stage.  
- WebApp backoffice for Entsnap Data validation v1.0
- Webapp for tree tokenization from Entsnap Data in development
- Five location based agreements to register/plant new endangered trees in 2024/2025



**Roadmap for this round (MA earth GG22):**
- Entsnap Open Beta ongoing. 
- UX new features proposal for Entsnap
- 4 Activities with "Escuela Chucao" community regarding Alerce tree (Fitzroya Cuprezoides) in Puerto Varas.
- Planting activity at Centro Los Maquis
- Queule Nursery support at El Hual-Hual


# Why support us?

*Problem to Solve*

**Endangered trees** are responsible for maintaining the health of most of the world's **endangered forest ecosystems**, but rarely produce relevant revenue for landowners (without being damaged) and even become **financial liabilities**, thus encouraging their ilegal felling. 



*Endangered Tokens‚Äô Solution*

**Leverage web3**, **dMRV** to incentivize the protection of these **scarce** beings by changing their status from merely the cost of maintaining a tree to a **revenue producing Bio-Asset**. Using NFTs ERC-721 we tokenize trees through imaging and georeferencing becoming pioneers in the tokenization of Natural Real World Assets (NRWA)


## Missions

1.-To **foster the protection** of endangered trees by bestowing them with **tangible value** in society.

2.-Form a **decentralized** investment community for biodiversity preservation, giving value and governance to stakeholders through **Crypto Assets**.
## Vision 

As humans we need to **revalue biodiversity** and living ecosystems through the preservation of Endangered Species, which are **invaluable natural assets** to society.
We envision a world where endangered and long lived trees are **not only preserved** but also revered for their **intrinsic value**, fostering a harmonious **coexistence** between **nature and society**.
 

---
### How will we accomplish this?


![](https://i.imgur.com/laF4AmK.png) 




**Endangered Tokens** is a **ReFi & DeSci NFT** community looking to revalue biodiversity by **tokenizing georeferenced endangered trees**. We are building a **real life impact** coordination game in which users can receive rewards for verifying georreferenced trees with their phones. Each specimen is characterized and photographed alongside a small verse description, and when owning one, you **become the godfather of a scarce endangered tree**!
With the funds raised we will help landowners and communities finance the **protection of endangered Forest** with **reforestation**, verification of **carbon credits** from the forests and the creation of quality **digital content & data** to add value to the tokens, among our activities within a territory we do:
* **Location based community activities**, engaging local communities to learn about Endangered Species and to register, verify and plant trees in a decentralized way. 
* **Georeferenced images and interactive mapping**, Taken through our Entsnap dApp in a decentralized way and available publicly.
* **Inmersive UX for ReFi Assets**, to engage with web3 enthusiasts and show the value of each token **as seen in real life**.
* **3D tourism experience** of the protected forests thus **reducing the footprint** of real life tourism while also generating a continuous flow of revenue to **keep supporting the protection of the forests**. 
* Using the 3D replicas of each tree as a virtual asset for **video games** and/or **augmented reality** experiences
* **Recording data** from the forest for research and enhanced digital experiences like music from the frequencies of the trees, **bioacoustics**, video recording of the ecosystems, **climate data**, water flow, among other relevant information.




NFT holders will receive a portion of the revenue that will come from the NFT Sales, tourism experiences, data management and carbon credits, thus converting endangered trees from liabilities to ***biodiversity assets for the future***. 

We are also developing a new type of Credit Class for Old Grown Trees (OGT credit Class) so any type of big tree can become a way of proving your positive impact in the world and a way of financing its protection, instead of cutting them down for wood.

---

### Which kind of trees are we talking about?

Endangered and Critically endangered trees, among other classificiations, are the ones that has 10000 specimens alive or less. You can check all endangered species on the [IUCN Redlist ](https://www.iucnredlist.org/)

We are currently working in **Chile** in South america, with the rare species [***Gomortega Keule***](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gomortega), or locally known as Queule. This magnificent beings are the last one of the *Gomortegacae* Family, dating its evolution to ***Pangea*** times. It is estimated that there are no more than 4000 specimens alive in the world! (*Scarcer than Bitcoin!*)


![](https://i.imgur.com/YsQ5Heb.jpg)


With the help of past Gitcoin Grants we are also making contacts and reviewing possible projects with the Brazilian Tree **"Pau Brasil" or [Paubrasilia echinata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paubrasilia)** an endangered Species of tree from which the country got it's name! The heavily abused lumbering by portuguese conquerors depleted their population and nowadays is a rare and unique living being. 

You can check more species we are going to work with here: https://www.endangeredtokens.org/entswiki 

---

### How will grant funding has been/will be spent?

As of the date of this 22th round of Gitcoin Grants (#GG21 #letsgrow) we have raised around 40000 DAI through Gitcoin that we have spent cautiously in development and growth and also have some saved for our roadmap goals. Without Gitcoin this project would not be able to keep moving forward as we have. We thank every supporter and every sponsor of the Climate Rounds, real world builders, Ma Earth and the Climate Coordination Network Collective for its amazing work! 

Things we have invested until now and will continue to invest:

Develop the products, contracts and DAPPs necessary to ensure mission fulfilment, growth and engagement. See ongoing projects for further detail. 



**2. Vital activities core team funding**
- [x] General administration
- [x] Coding and development
- [x] Marketing and community growth

**3. Endangered Tokens Conservation program** for location based activities

**4. Marketing and community building**

We have realized that a crypto community needs to be active, engaged and in constant growth in order to stay healthy. This is an important pillar of investment on top of a marketing lead within the team. Among other things, we have attended several Crypto Conferences creating network and alliances with important crypto and ReFi Actors. 


**5. Decentralization**

One of the challenges faced has been to improve decentralization within the projects. Part of the funds will go to improve decentralization each round.

**6. Equipment**

In order to experiment, record, experience and iterate on our products we have invested in technology like the Plantsplay device, HD Camera, Meta Oculus Quest 2 and looking to purchase a 360¬∞ action cam for content creation within the forest.

project.title: ReFi Barcelona
project.description:
![Untitled](https://refi-dao.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50%2F52f11c0a-10cb-4cf3-bb46-ea9b79d3c7fb%2FUntitled.jpeg?table=block&id=2ee662a9-f487-4741-9e87-1df5bab05bcc&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

ReFi Barcelona is a collective working on bridging global movements and infrastructure - such as¬†[ReFi](https://refibcn.cat/Ecosystem+Map/Global+-+ReFi+and+Web3/ReFi+Ecosystem)¬†(Regenerative Finance), [CoFi](https://www.notion.so/91c2b86127b44257a6f36263f8b3e774?pvs=21) (Collaborative Finance) and the broad Web3 just to name a few- with local groups and movements working toward the so called [ecosocial transition](https://www.bcn.coop/transicio-ecosocial/), assembled in the¬†[Ecosystem Map](https://refibcn.cat/Ecosystem+Map/Ecosystem+map).

In one sentence: our aim is to build bridges!

![Untitled](https://file.notion.so/f/f/9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50/72cbe3f2-749b-4123-a285-e1dceb5cd46a/Untitled.gif?table=block&id=fef57488-edd6-46ba-89ff-bab7e723d10d&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&expirationTimestamp=1723046400000&signature=mcQ40d7Oa7Yyh1b2qb62w7zdsXhL9SIUpJSnXRO4QhQ)

We recognize that to do our work effectively, we need to generate income that allows for the growth of the node and the development of our activities. At [ReFi Barcelona Unconference 2024](https://www.notion.so/Resources-Links-0ad80a7c87994ef2b7e820057ec842ef?pvs=21) we validated the interest of various organizations and projects in engaging with us, in the perspective of a long term alliance for the regeneration of our bioregion.

Therefore, we want to establish a grounded node with a legal entity to engage with these organizations, providing services and assistance to facilitate their work. We believe that the Worker Cooperative format aligns with the needs and vision of the node, as well as fitting nicely with the economic and political history of Barcelona.

***2023***

- *July ‚Äò23*
    - ReFi Barcelona Kick-Off event
- *August ‚Äò23*
    - Participation in GG19 ReFi Local Nodes round

![ReFi Barcelona Kick-Off Event](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/F1z0YbgWIAETCCQ?format=jpg&name=900x900)

***2024***

- *April ‚Äò24*
    - Launch of the Ecosystem Map and Knowledge Base
    - ReFi Unconference Barcelona event



### ReFi Unconference Barcelona

![Tweet image (4).jpeg](https://refi-dao.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50%2Ff3636c0b-aac6-4fbd-9e72-1763ef3ee031%2FTweet_image_(4).jpeg?table=block&id=7e612a47-58f6-4316-872c-0ca1b72c9dd5&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&width=860&userId=&cache=v2)

The ReFi Unconference Barcelona, organized by ReFi Barcelona local node in collaboration with the Crypto Commons Association and Trusted Seed, brought together relevant local projects focused on the Eco-Social Transition with key stakeholders from the global ReFi ecosystem. 

Held at Akasha Hub with collaborations including local ecological groups and ReFi projects like Silvi, which supported a tree planting workshop through Operation Web Tree.

**Impact Metrics**

- **Participants**: 40
- **Sessions**: 30
- **Carbon Offset**: 200 tons (in partnership with Regen Network)
- **Trees Repotted**: 11 (to be planted in Collserolla Natural Park using Silvi for tracking)+

![CBABD762-4BD0-435F-A243-C4C1A90B79B7_1_105_c.jpeg](https://refi-dao.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50%2F26ae1782-6b2c-44ae-acd6-adbea61ddc8d%2FCBABD762-4BD0-435F-A243-C4C1A90B79B7_1_105_c.jpeg?table=block&id=8a666501-5749-4dc6-9a5e-e866ac53ff6f&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&width=770&userId=&cache=v2)

You can explore all the video recordings and materials of the event [here](https://www.notion.so/Resources-Links-0ad80a7c87994ef2b7e820057ec842ef?pvs=21)! 

![F19EAA52-B537-46B6-8BB6-99DAE5B66781_1_105_c.jpeg](https://refi-dao.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50%2F989e0458-0041-46dd-8b2c-9c860bbd47dc%2FF19EAA52-B537-46B6-8BB6-99DAE5B66781_1_105_c.jpeg?table=block&id=93bd6c84-85e6-45a0-8cfb-213ac8d1d634&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&width=770&userId=&cache=v2)

![Refibarce Sponsored Organized (1).png](https://refi-dao.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50%2Fdec05d56-6c4b-403a-b67c-462b09c707ce%2FRefibarce_Sponsored_Organized_(1).png?table=block&id=89c871b8-79f3-4945-a734-5aa5563656fb&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&width=1060&userId=&cache=v2)

### ReFi BCN Ecosystem Map & Knowledge Base

![ReFi Barcelona Knowledge Base - https://ReFiBCN.cat](https://refi-dao.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50%2Ffb1a9a20-0f03-45ec-bb57-1b81a92bb0c5%2FUntitled.png?table=block&id=4fa233e4-1034-4cbf-9665-b9c3ba0b52f4&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&width=1340&userId=&cache=v2)

ReFi Barcelona Knowledge Base - https://ReFiBCN.cat

As our first non-event initiative, we‚Äôve conducted a research on the value-aligned ecosystem of projects of Barcelona and Catalonia, with focuses on the Social & Solidarity Economy and tech-enablers such as ReFi and Web3 - and compiled it all in an Ecosystem Map structured as a knowledge base.

It highlights the fields we want to explore with ReFi BCN. We see information as the foundation for building any of these bridges. Being so, that's the layer we've been tackling first.

Check-out the ecosystem map & knowledge base ‚Üí https://ReFiBCN.cat

## 3. Node Stewards

**Luiz Fernando G√≥mez Segala** - Coordination Lead: founder and lead of ReFi Barcelona ‚Ä¢ Core Steward at ReFi DAO ‚Ä¢ Steward (Gardener) at Trusted Seed ‚Ä¢ interested in weaving connections and building bridges

- https://twitter.com/louizfe
- https://www.linkedin.com/in/luizfernandosg/

**Emilia Sierra Guzman** - Community Lead: GUARDIANA DE LA TIERRA üíö ‚Ä¢ Creative Director ‚Ä¢ Brand Strategist ‚Ä¢ Innovation & Impact Strategy Consultant ‚Ä¢ Educator

- https://twitter.com/EmiliaEarth
- https://www.linkedin.com/in/emilia-earth-395b17171/

**Giulio Quarta** - Business Lead: Co-Founder, director and ecosystem strategist at CCA, Initiator and Lead of Commons Economy Roadmap.

- [https://](https://x.com/GiulioQuarta_)[twitter](https://twitter.com/EmiliaEarth)[.com/GiulioQuarta_](https://x.com/GiulioQuarta_)
- https://www.linkedin.com/in/giulio-quarta-b01a46122/

## 4. Focus Areas

### **4.1. Social & Solidarity Economy (ESS)**

The Social & Solidarity Economy (ESS) focuses on creating economic systems that prioritize social well-being, holistic sustainability and solidarity over profit maximization. It includes cooperatives, social enterprises, and community-based organizations that operate on principles of mutual aid, democratic decision-making, and social justice. In Barcelona, ESS is vital for fostering a resilient and inclusive local economy that supports sustainable development and social cohesion.

**Specific Goals/Objectives:**

- Constitute ReFi BCN as a workers cooperative, to be fully nested in the economic ecosystems we want to influence.
- Establish a diverse set of connections with local and bioregional networks, with the aim of becoming a regenerative super node.
- Act as a bridge between the Social & Solidarity Economy and the ReFi movement.

**Challenges/Barriers:**

- The majority of ESS actors are hostile toward crypto, mostly for good reasons.
- ESS is made of socio-economic networks with high density of trust, which is why they are so precious and a model to follow, but this also makes them more demanding in term of bridging work.
- Politically active worlds as ESS involve an extra layer of complexity to be managed, in comparison with less politics-oriented spaces.

**Target Populations/Stakeholders:**

- Local cooperatives and social enterprises, credit unions, cooperatives of cooperatives.
- Community organizations and local food networks.
- Residents of Barcelona and the surrounding region.

**Core Partnerships/Potential Collaborations:**

- [Xarxa d'Economia Solid√†ria (XES)](https://xes.cat/): network promoting solidarity economy in Catalonia.
- [Co√≤polis - Ateneu Cooperatiu de Barcelona](https://www.bcn.coop/): Barcelona hub of the¬†(XES), its primary focus is on fostering new cooperatives and creating job opportunities within existing ones.
- [Resilience.Earth](https://resilience.earth/): non-profit cooperative focused on enhancing community resilience and regenerative design as pivotal instruments for socio-ecological transformation.
- [Holon](https://holon.cat/): cooperative agency that designs products, services, policies, and futures for ecosocial transitions.
- [Bloc4](https://bloc4.coop/): cooperative space that houses Co√≤polis and its supported early-stage cooperatives, among others.

### **4.2. Regenerative Land Work & Stewardship**

Regenerative land work and stewardship aim to restore and enhance the health of ecosystems through regenerative agricultural practices, community engagement, and ecological design. This focus area is crucial for maintaining biodiversity, improving soil health, and promoting livelihoods in rural areas. We would like to move the discussion around the ‚Äúsustainability‚Äù framework: sustainability is not enough, we need (ecosocial) regeneration!

**Specific Goals/Objectives:**

- Provide material benefits, support, and mentorship to groups involved in regenerative land work.
- Fundraise and offer Gitcoin support to sustain these initiatives.
- Prioritizing the building of trust over anything else, especially over revenues generation. The second should never put the first at risk.

**Challenges/Barriers:**

- Limited access to funding and resources for small-scale regenerative projects.
- Need for knowledge transfer and capacity building.
- Balancing ecological goals with the generation of meaningful revenues.

**Target Populations/Stakeholders:**

- Regenerative farmers and land stewards, expert communities.
- Rural communities in Barcelona and surrounding areas.
- Environmental and agricultural organizations and movements

**Core Partnerships/Potential Collaborations:**

- [Fundaci√≥ Emprius](https://emprius.cat/): Focuses on communal culture and sustainable rural development.
- [Mas la Sala](https://www.maslasala.org/): A cooperative promoting ecosystem regeneration and sustainable agriculture.
- [Mas Les Vinyes](https://www.maslesvinyes.com/): A permaculture farm committed to sustainable food production and water conservation.
- [Can Masdeu](https://canmasdeu.net/): A community cooperation space rooted in Collserola, with regenerative land work.
- [Arran de Terra](https://arrandeterra.org/): Promotes just and sustainable food systems through Agroecology and Food Sovereignty, supporting local ecological production and social cohesion.

### **4.3. Local Food Systems**

Local food systems emphasize local, community-based food production and distribution networks. They aim to provide healthy, fair, and environmentally-friendly food options, while supporting local farmers and reducing the carbon footprint of food consumption.

**Specific Goals/Objectives:**

- Engage with stakeholders to understand and improve local food systems.
- Promote the relevance of regenerative farmers and land stewards in the local food value chain.
- Raise awareness about the problems of green capitalism and techno-solutionism in food systems.

**Challenges/Barriers:**

- Navigating the significant complexities of local food networks and market dynamics.
- Overcoming resistance to non-regenerative approaches from certain stakeholders.
- Facing the very entrenched and damaging power structures which constitutes the not-regenerative status quo.

**Target Populations/Stakeholders:**

- Local farmers and food producers.
- Consumers seeking better and fairer food options.
- Community organizations and food cooperatives.

**Core Partnerships/Potential Collaborations:**

- [Foodcoop BCN](https://foodcoopbcn.cat/): A cooperative supermarket promoting sustainable and fair products.
- [LaCoordi](https://lacoordi.cat/): Facilitates projects for global justice and sustainable economic models.
- [Opcions](https://opcions.coop/): Encourages conscious consumption aligned with sustainability and social justice values.

### **4.4. Events & Pluralities of Education**

ReFi Barcelona events and polyvocal education initiatives aim to raise awareness, build capacity, and foster a community around regenerative finance and related fields. These activities are crucial for spreading knowledge, encouraging participation, and driving the adoption of regenerative financial practices, with an attention to the social and cultural complexities of the specific context. We aim to disseminate the concept of regenerative finance in more conventional educational and financial settings, such as universities, governmental institutions, and community spaces. 

**Specific Goals/Objectives:**

- Connect with cooperative and innovation hubs, as ImpactHub and Bloc44.
- Organize and participate in events to promote ReFi concepts and practices.
- Develop a plurality of educational programs (form, content, goal wise) to enhance understanding of ReFi among a variety of stakeholders.

**Challenges/Barriers:**

- Ensuring sufficient attendance and engagement at events, and growing the community with the proper pace - not too fast, not too slow.
- Balancing ‚Äútheoretical‚Äù and ethical education with ‚Äúpractical‚Äù dimensions and present strategies.
- Achieving a balance between too much and too little socio-cultural variety, as both scenarios bring problems.

**Target Populations/Stakeholders:**

- Entrepreneurs and startups in the fintech and sustainability sectors.
- Community spaces and networks interested in alternative finance.
- Educational institutions and non-formal education actors.

**Core Partnerships/Potential Collaborations:**

- Akasha Hub
- ESADE and ELISAVA Universities
- Impact Hub

## 5. Projects & Initiatives

![Screenshot 2024-08-05 at 20.51.20.png](https://refi-dao.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50%2F1c3e34b5-aa23-4559-b01f-3ca8d157ec71%2FScreenshot_2024-08-05_at_20.51.20.png?table=block&id=922c2ec9-1893-4914-b83b-709976840a9a&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&width=1560&userId=&cache=v2)

### ReFi BCN Cooperative Constitution

**Stage**: Planning

**Timeframe:** Q4‚Äô24

**Description**:
The establishment of ReFi BCN as a legal entity in the form of a workers' cooperative is essential for formalizing our operations. This legal structure will enable us to engage in formal partnerships, receive and make payments, and provide a stable framework for our activities. Support from Co√≤polis (Ateneu Cooperatiu de Barcelona) will be instrumental in this process.

**Goals**:

- Legal establishment of ReFi BCN as a cooperative.
- Facilitate financial transactions and partnerships.

**Target Audience**:

- Local organizations, partners, and stakeholders.

**Key Partners**:

- Co√≤polis, Bloc4

**Funding Sources**:

- Local grants, cooperative support programs.

### Direct Support to Local Regenerative Projects & Communities

**Stage**: Planning

**Timeframe:** Immediate, as possible

**Description**:
We plan to provide direct support to local regenerative projects and communities through fundraising efforts and other support mechanisms. This includes offering mentorship, resources, and financial assistance to projects that align with our mission.

**Goals**:

- Raise funds to support local regenerative initiatives.
- Build a network of supported projects and communities.

**Target Audience**:

- Local regenerative communities and projects.

**Key Partners**:

- Emprius, Bioma, Akasha Hub, XR BCN, Federaci√≥ d¬¥Ecologistes en Acci√≥ de Catalunya.

**Funding Sources**:

- Fundraising campaigns, grants, community donations.

### Community & Educational Events

**Stage**: Planning and Pilot

**Timeframe:** Pilots in Q3‚Äô and Q4‚Äô24, consistent events in 2025.

**Description**:

- **Community Events:** experiment with different informal gathering formats, such as meetings in parks or bars, to determine the most effective way to engage the community.
- **Educational Events:** promote awareness and understanding of ReFi in various settings, including fintech, business schools, and innovation hubs.

**Goals**:

- Organize 1-2 events in October or November 2024.
- Establish a regular community meetup format by 2025.

**Target Audience**:

- Local community members, web3 enthusiasts, entrepreneurs, startups, and broader regenerative movement participants.

**Key Partners**:

- Community events: Web3Family, Crypto Monday, Digital Nomads Weekly Meetup, Barcelona Entrepreneurs meetup
- Educational events: Fintech BCN, Barcelona TechHub, ImpactHub, ESADE University.

**Funding Sources**:

- Event sponsorships, donations, educational grants, institutional partnerships.

### ReFi *Unconference* Barcelona 2025

**Stage**: Planning

**Timeframe:** Q1‚Äô or Q2‚Äô25.

**Description**:
To make the ReFi Unconference Barcelona an yearly (or eventually by quarter) event, by organizing the follow-up iteration in 2025.

**Goals**:

- Host a successful unconference.
- Strengthen connections with local communities.

**Target Audience**:

- ReFi community, local stakeholders, global participants.

**Key Partners**:

- Crypto Commons Association, Trusted Seed.

**Funding Sources**:

- Event sponsorships, ticket sales, grants.

## 6. Node Finances

- 0xd30CAa4260A16994510d5858A2f4ce7Bb506a294 (ReFiBCN.eth) - Hot Wallet
- 0x9Ea21b99E9B614a3d9f73C7EeE051ECfa3E434E6 - OP SAFE
- 0x9343e042E8bB2fdCade0666c8BFE4BAe7741afe0 - CELO SAFE

### Fundraising History & Current Financial Position

**GG19 ReFi Local Nodes Round**

- Direct donations ‚âà 74.40 USD
- Matching ‚âà 492.81 USD

**ReFi Unconference Barcelona ‚Äò24**

*ReFi Barcelona didn‚Äôt have any direct income or expenses with the event, as it was covered by the other organizing parties - Crypto Commons Association and Trusted Seed.*

## 7. Additional Resources

**Website, Ecosystem Map & Knowledge Base**

[Home - ReFi Barcelona](https://refibcn.cat/)

**ReFi Unconference Barcelona**

- Gallery
    
    [ReFi Unconference Barcelona '24](https://photos.google.com/share/AF1QipMeo7BUxiryQ7t70hHuuMXoifEJBGIwvJ5Ijd9UwThm-C1r1Z1C9d5RYKkaUJH4RQ?key=TVlwUXRvcU53OUxWY2x3T3FhQVM5ZFM1azI3Sm5B)
    
- Videos & Material
    
    [ReFi Unconference Barcelona - Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/17UA-tvhXO5B70TS6uZ79QbogD78GhQcS)
    
- All Resources
    
    [Resources & Links](https://www.notion.so/Resources-Links-0ad80a7c87994ef2b7e820057ec842ef?pvs=21) - [https://www.notion.so/commonseconomy/Resources-Links-0ad80a7c87994ef2b7e820057ec842ef](https://www.notion.so/Resources-Links-0ad80a7c87994ef2b7e820057ec842ef?pvs=21)

![unt](https://refi-dao.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50%2F822f779d-c232-4b7b-afe2-0855bba3ed5b%2FBarcecloud_(1).png?table=block&id=6dbcbc90-db76-417c-b1f7-03dba30d23f8&spaceId=9eeee20f-56b7-4e26-be85-2292d6b2ec50&width=1560&userId=&cache=v2)

metadata.title: ReFi Barcelona
metadata.description:
## **A Local Node as a Rooted Cooperative  üå±**

[**ReFi Barcelona**](https://refibcn.cat/Home_CAT) is a local node within the global [**ReFi movement**](https://refibcn.cat/Ecosystem+Map/Global+-+ReFi+and+Web3/ReFi+Ecosystem), focused on connecting **regenerative finance, local regenerators and the Social & Solidarity Economy (ESS)** in Barcelona and across Catalonia - to drive forward the so called **[ecosocial transition](https://www.bcn.coop/transicio-ecosocial/).**

We‚Äôre also part of a broader bioregional effort through [**ReFi Mediterranean**](https://www.regencoordination.xyz/refi-mediterranean-gg23), where we collaborate with other nodes across the bioregion to scale regenerative strategies and funding mechanisms for regenerative work.

> We serve as a bridge between global Web3 infrastructure and place-based economic transformation.
> 

### Our Approach: Building Hybrid Systems Through Cooperative Structures **üåç**

ReFi Barcelona is a **proof of concept** for building regenerative systems that are both **technologically innovative and socially grounded**.

We believe that to regenerate economies, we need **hybrid infrastructures** that:

- **Leverage Web3** for transparency, coordination, and composability; as well as for opening opportunities for funding and support
- **Integrate cooperative models** for human-scale governance and economic justice
- **Learn from local territories**, while staying globally connected

### Our plan: Growing from the roots of cooperativism üå≤

To build systems that work beyond theory, we need **real-world grounding**.

That‚Äôs why ReFi BCN is based at [**Bloc4**](https://bloc4.coop/), Europe‚Äôs largest cooperative innovation hub ‚Äî home to more than 40 cooperatives and social enterprises. Bloc4 provides:

- Access to **funding channels beyond Web3** (public & cooperative finance)
- **Mentorship and training** in governance, sustainability and viability
- Daily exposure to the **needs, tools and culture** of ESS actors
- Incubation from Bloc4/Co√≤polis, Barcelona's cooperative development agency

> Bloc4 amplifies our ability to design, test and share
> 
> 
> **hybrid regenerative models with the local Social & Solidarity Economy.**
> 

![image.png](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/a19384a8-35f8-46d0-b142-acbaeef51911/New_Draft_Image.png?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-808a-bc32-f89393d277a5&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=Cghq6RBqD1P8zGTv712jfQ4SdR_II1VTHm398sLtUlE&downloadName=New+Draft+Image.png)

![photo_2025-03-27 13.53.32.jpeg](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/09458670-9d1e-4f73-b6a3-abee709f28f9/New_Draft_Photo_Mar_27_2025.jpeg?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-801a-929b-d114ed900336&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=Yls5cDU8H6LB1xGoVBPQwxH35YMKv0MYX0XvYGyd7gM&downloadName=New+Draft+Photo+Mar+27+2025.jpeg)

## The strategic lines we are building üéç

We‚Äôve identified the following key strategic lines of work to support the work of local regenerators. These pillars guide our activities and shape our approach to supporting the ecosocial transition.

Our strategic lines are designed as a progression, from building awareness to enabling action:

1. **üìö Knowledge, Research & Education** ‚Äî *From unawareness to understanding*
    
    We develop open knowledge and its repositories, materials, and practical guides that make regenerative concepts accessible to diverse audiences, with special attention to connecting global ReFi innovations with local contexts and needs, and vice versa.
    
    - [ReFi BCN Knowledge Base](https://refibcn.cat/Ecosystem+Map/Ecosystem+Map)

2. **üë• Community & Network** ‚Äî *From understanding to collaboration*
    
    We organize events and spaces for connection, dialogue, and mutual learning between local and global actors.
    
    - ReFi Unconference Barcelona ‚Äò24
    - BioFi Barcelona ‚Äò25

3. **‚ôªÔ∏è Financial Resources** ‚Äî *From collaboration to supporting tangible impact*
    
    We aim to help local projects access regenerative funding through Web3 platforms and ethical banking in the Social & Solidarity economy, exploring how to create hybrid financial structures to support the much-needed regenerative work on the ground.
    
    - Piloting with the ReFi Mediterranean GG23 round

4. **‚öñÔ∏è Governance & Innovation** ‚Äî *From consolidation to systemic transformation (future)*
    
    On the horizon, we‚Äôd like to promote governance approaches that combine cooperative principles with DAOs, exploring different models to fund and develop local communities‚Äîsuch as democratic decision-making, established financial flows, quadratic funding, community currencies, and more. This pillar will activate in a future phase as the network strengthens.
    

---

# 2. What we are currently working on **üåø**

### ü´Ç Cooperative Constitution

- First ReFi node to register as a legally recognized **workers cooperative (SCCL)**
- Incubated by [**Co√≤polis**](https://www.bcn.coop/), Barcelona‚Äôs cooperative incubator
- We‚Äôre undergoing official training, forming bylaws, and building viable economic plans ‚Äî with oversight from the most respected cooperative actors in Catalonia.
- Laying the legal and economic foundation for ReFi BCN infrastructure
- Establishing a practical model for ReFi nodes to integrate with local economic structures

### üåç Upcoming *BioFi Barcelona* Event in May 2025

- Flagship event on **Bioregional Finance in Barcelona**
- Organized in collaboration with the Commons Agency; hosted at Bloc4 with
- Bringing ecological thinking into financial infrastructure

### üåä ReFi Mediterranean: Bioregional Coordination in Action

ReFi BCN is playing a foundational role in building **ReFi Mediterranean**, a bioregional collaboration hub across the bioregion.

We are:

- Co-creating a **shared regenerative plan** for the Mediterranean
- Piloting **Gitcoin rounds** to fund **local regenerators**
- Onboarding projects into **GG23** and beyond

---

# 3. What we‚Äôve done so far üåæ

### üó∫Ô∏è Ecosystem Map & Knowledge Base

![Gitcoin Explorer (1).webp](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/1314987e-4370-45e1-8f32-2278ac2ed726/Gitcoin_Explorer_(1)_(1).webp?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-80e1-8279-d4edad118255&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=bI0n7QQm7-dDPDfIlP1mm1_1dI2sy8N1O6hPGAZ5iC8&downloadName=Gitcoin+Explorer+(1)+(1).webp)

We've created a comprehensive research resource that maps value-aligned actors across Barcelona and Catalonia, with specific focus on:

- Social & Solidarity Economy organizations
- Web3 and ReFi projects
- Regenerative practitioners and initiatives

The knowledge base serves as a foundation for our work by documenting the existing ecosystem and identifying potential bridges between communities.

> This knowledge base is a living research tool ‚Äî not just for us, but for any one to explore, expand and build upon.
> 

Check-out the ecosystem map & knowledge base ‚Üí¬†[**https://ReFiBCN.cat**](https://refibcn.cat/)

### üå± ReFi Unconference Barcelona 2024

![LiÃÅnea de Tiempo Para Negocio Degradado Llamativo Moderno Colorido Azul Lila Negro (3).png](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/94a648e7-4d5e-4356-bdbb-7f8088f9c681/Modern_Colorful_Timeline_Draft.png?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-801d-80bb-e71791592d8c&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=hd7ZBOibpxTg4S2KB2XF7JVzr2nPli7_noA4ciHqfg8&downloadName=Modern+Colorful+Timeline+Draft.png)

The¬†[**ReFi Unconference Barcelona**](https://www.notion.so/c184c3edc6ef462c9e64d49985d2b63e?pvs=21), organized by ReFi Barcelona local node in collaboration with the Crypto Commons Association and Trusted Seed, brought together relevant local projects focused on the Eco-Social Transition with key stakeholders from the global ReFi ecosystem.

- 40+ stakeholders and 30+ sessions from the ReFi and related ecosystems
- üé• [Watch the sessions](https://www.notion.so/0ad80a7c87994ef2b7e820057ec842ef?pvs=21) and check the resources

# 4. Who we are üë§

![Luizfernandolfsg 1024.jpg](https://file.notion.so/f/f/98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e/91b34598-600e-487a-aa2a-d518106b7cc6/New_Draft_Luizfernandolfsg_1024.jpg?table=block&id=1c86ed08-45cb-8052-9af3-d52970a9518c&spaceId=98673c04-e3cf-4b0a-8f3c-a85c8332f21e&expirationTimestamp=1743616800000&signature=13QCJJbCqDVj8rFMc5txN6c8pKrOHRWt-CAMII9gngM&downloadName=New+Draft+Luizfernandolfsg+1024.jpg)
