Regens Unite - Bridging Climate Solutions with Events & Media

metadata.title: Regens Unite - Rooted Locally, Connected Globally
metadata.description:
*A platform for community events and educational media. ‚≠êFeatured on the [Green Pill Podcast](https://youtu.be/opmc7-QM1zo?si=z_W_bkzUJn04Rl3b).‚≠ê*

---

![](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407%2F98e7aecc-4191-4406-8f97-356a7c62701a%2FFor_web3_to_have_an_impact_on_the_world_it_must_connect_with_the_people_working_on_the_ground..svg?table=block&id=65ca6e23-6f57-4167-89dc-75e1ced45f50&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&userId=&cache=v2)

---

Regens Unite is building a platform to bridge the gaps between the broad range of sectors working on regenerative climate solutions, connecting expertise with innovation.

Launched in May 2022, we‚Äôve successfully run [**23 IRL events**](https://www.regensunite.earth/#events) with a growing roster of new locations. Our curated, in-person gatherings have programs designed to guide participants through professionally facilitated discussions and knowledge-sharing experiences.

- **Intimate & Intentional Event Curation** - With a team of experienced facilitators, we organise inclusive, participatory events.
- **Facilitation & Programming Services -** We support other events through programming partnerships, facilitation training or consulting, and marketing.
- **Educational content -** We produce digital media such as [after-movies, session recordings](https://www.youtube.com/@regensunite/videos), a newsletter, & a handbook to share learnings and support a growing network of climate-focused builders and regens.

---

![Our Impact](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/attachment%3Ae2af761b-0bed-4513-915d-7cad41f3edd4%3AOur_impact.svg?table=block&id=1c985972-5d29-80fd-9ab7-c5e22e9034aa&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&userId=&cache=v2)

***Events:***

# üáπüá≠ The Regen Hub at Devcon 7 SEA

In November at Devcon 7 SEA in Thailand, Regens Unite hosted the [Regen Hub](https://x.com/regensunite/status/1870082140513128700), a 4-day community-driven experience connecting Southeast Asian changemakers with the global Web3 community.

- 500+ active participants
- 200+ regens mapped
- 30+ hours of programming
- 25+ projects showcased

The space became a vibrant hub for collaboration, education, and exploration of regenerative work. Local initiatives from Thailand and Southeast Asia took center stage, bridging communities and inspiring newcomers to the movement.

A heartfelt thank-you to the 40+ contributors who brought this incredible experience to life!

Check out our recap video üëá

[![Watch the video](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/attachment%3Aeee3593a-0cf4-4175-8f52-ee8d575d7fd5%3ARegen_Hub_Bangkok_Thumbnail.png?table=block&id=bdb4a3cf-9950-44f4-9177-8e28c60f7582&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3VTNtFKfPpw)

---

# üáπüá≠ New to Web3? Start Here - Bangkok Edition

Regens Unite was honored to be an organizational partner in the first edition of ["New to Web3? Start Here"](https://x.com/OrnellaWeb3/status/1855821681098719673), a practical, Ethereum-focused, blockchain onboarding experience for the local Thai community in Bangkok.

This one-day event included panels, games, a wallet setup workshop, and a garden of booths for attendees to learn how to complete their first transaction, mint an NFT, learn about regenerative communities in Web3, DAOs, and more. 

Other organizational partners: Bankless Academy, and Coalan from ETHDublin. Sponsored by Harpie, and supported by an extended partner network. We were the only onboarding event offered in Thai language out of 600+ side events.

- 80+ local Bangkok students and mentors participated
- Verified over 200 onchain actions:
	- 47 new wallets connected to our event app
	- 50 POAPs and NFTs minted (18 minted their first NFT ever)
	- 35 participants claimed ETH & USDC on Base
	- 25 completed their first onchain swap

Check out our recap video üëá

[![Watch the video](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/attachment%3Abd9581cf-fa04-40dc-a998-79499a61c617%3ANew2Web3_Thumbnail.png?table=block&id=2943f660-3052-45ba-bc6d-b5ab87235089&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)](https://x.com/OrnellaWeb3/status/1876649569976471615)

---

# üáßüá™ Regen Village @ EthCC 2024

We produced the [Regen Village](https://regenvillage.webflow.io/) alongside EthCC 2024 in Brussels, which included 5 days of programming partnerships with Superchain Eco, How to DAO, Kevin Owocki, Proof of Vibes, & more.

Recap thread here: [https://x.com/regensunite/status/1813920871091999144](https://x.com/regensunite/status/1813920871091999144)

- 600+ attendees
- 7823 $RegenBxl issued via NFC wristbands
- 25k‚Ç¨ kickstarter fund raised for a [local innovation hub](https://commonshub.brussels/)

Check out our recap video üëá

[![Watch the video](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407%2Fec316815-fba5-456c-9c4f-f7e68134b8f0%2FRegen_Village_Thumbnail.png?table=block&id=7354bb24-d2aa-44f3-9935-132919e4dd20&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&width=1530&userId=&cache=v2)](https://youtu.be/FSCi_173Alw)

***Media:***

- [Sizzle after-video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FSCi_173Alw&list=PLGWVbDCsjn0jivWTsKYeIHey6gv_0kTv0&index=1) from Regen Village Brussels 2024
- [Session recordings](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLGWVbDCsjn0jivWTsKYeIHey6gv_0kTv0) from Regen Village Brussels 2024

![](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407%2F3373e5cd-9808-409d-b2ef-003462a3ad1d%2FScreenshot_2024-08-01_at_17.07.24.png?table=block&id=656e6292-b365-4258-8dcf-a90f0585757e&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&width=1420&userId=&cache=v2)

---

![](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407%2Fb5a64797-7d0a-4239-b250-e07b78f289ca%2FWhat_your_funds_are_supporting_.svg?table=block&id=3d5eab30-b361-4d8e-9cf9-4f9987a4fe83&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&userId=&cache=v2)

Our goal is to raise funds to build out the next initiatives for the Regens Unite community, and support our organising, communications, programming, and facilitation work.

# **1.¬†Events üßë‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüßë**

**Berlin Blockchain Week**: we are in discussion with other partners to coordinate an event focused on bridging AI, ReFi, and Regen Web3.

**Amsterdam**: We are partnering with global organisers hosting a series of events and residencies alongside Dutch Blockchain Week, and supporting the launch of the [Cosmolocal Playground](https://cosmolocal.space/).

**Mumbai**: We are partnering with local organisers curating an event to inspire and educate the youth of Mumbai on ReFi, Web3 and Climate Activism.

**Devconnect Argentina**: We are submitting a proposal for a Regen Community Hub to connect local projects and changemakers with global attendees, similar to the one we produced previously in Bangkok.



# **2. Educational Media and Storytelling Platform üé•**

**Recorded Content**: we are publishing recorded event sessions from our digital webinars, 1-1 project interviews, and after-movies from our last events.

**Community Showcase**: A discovery hub for ReFi and climate-focused communities in Web3. The next version will spotlight impactful projects, useful tools, supportive networks, onboarding resources, and key builders.

# **3. A Collaborative Regen Ecosystem ü§ù**

**Toolkits for Event Organizers:** We‚Äôll support organizers to host events under or with Regens Unite branding, as a response to ongoing interest in gatherings focused on ReFi, Web3, climate, activism, art, and more.

**Media Partnerships and Regen Alliances:** Regenerative development requires collaboration over competition, so we‚Äôre brewing an alliance of community-building initiatives across the web3 ecosystem. We are also organically expanding our impact and reach through aligned storytelling partnerships.

---

![](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407%2F03e3e609-0541-48a4-9976-280b7e65b737%2FWhat_Regens_Unite_is_bringing_to_web3.svg?table=block&id=caf641bc-7377-465b-9c3d-9421562d02be&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&userId=&cache=v2)

It‚Äôs no secret that web3 needs more diversity and more expertise to achieve true systems change at a global scale. If we want to build regenerative systems and address the climate crisis effectively, we need everyone involved in the solution design process.

We are evolving the web3 space by:

- **Bringing in expertise** from sectors outside of web3 to broaden the regen movement
- Providing an avenue for innovative web3 projects to conduct research and receive **rapid feedback** outside of their bubble
- Designing events with high-quality interaction, and safe spaces for experimentation to **co-create web3 projects with local regens.**
- **Driving inclusivity and diversity in web3** through curated attendance, using application processes & scholarships
- **Creating toolkits and media** to elevate project stories, educate on the regen movement, and inspire new groups to get involved

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/B1WnhShlC.png)

---

![](https://regensunite.notion.site/image/https%3A%2F%2Fprod-files-secure.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com%2F7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407%2F668b2193-8cb7-4aaa-834b-1fdd24fe4a81%2FWhere_were_going.svg?table=block&id=b7dc65be-6e9e-4256-9dda-66428992dcb9&spaceId=7bc385fa-917d-4c6b-af2b-58bba8eaf407&userId=&cache=v2)



We have a growing pipeline of requests from event organizers across the world to grow the movement, and we are continuing to build a platform to connect regens with learnings, resources, and mutual support.

**Thank you in advance for your support. Every donation counts to help us further our mission to unite all types of regens around the world!**

---

üü¢ [Visit our Website](https://regensunite.earth/)

üü¢ [Join Telegram group](https://t.me/regensunite)

üü¢¬†[Follow us on Twitter](https://twitter.com/regensunite)

project.title: GreenPill India Chapter
project.description:
# About the chapter

As a chapter of the¬†[GreenPill Network](https://greenpill.network/), GreenPill India is committed to converging regenerative digital infrastructure with grassroots efforts in India to drive local outcomes for global problems in coordination. With a population of 1.4 billion, India holds a massive opportunity to unlock the gains from combining coordination mechanisms to drive local outcomes for global problems.

# Who are we

We are an assembly of ReFi founders, designers, engineers, writers, and web3 enthusiasts who were busy in our rabbit holes until most of us met each other at various points since early 2022 when the book GreenPilled launched the meme of regenerative crypto-economics into the world. While each of us has been striving in our primary role to revive public goods in our projects, in our individual and collective capacity, we have been championing the need to fund, design, develop, and market a future rooted in regeneration.

# Milestones in last 12 months

-   June 2024:¬†Establish a partnership with a retainer contract with a local biodiversity farm,¬†[Nature Inspires](https://www.facebook.com/NIChiguruecospace/), based near Bangalore, to drive immersive educational experiences on actionable insights for eco-friendly sustainable living

-   March 2024:¬†Conducted a¬†[half-day community visit](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india/farm-visit)¬†to Nature Inspires farm, Chiguru Ecospace, to bridge the world of web3 enthusiasts, builders, and thinkers with the grassroots wisdom of sustainable living.

-   March 2024: Designed and delivered a¬†[2-day workshop on DAOs](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india/dao)¬†for faculty at Punjabi University Centre for Emerging and Innovative Technology

-   February 2024: Conducted¬†[workshop on understanding and applying quadratic voting](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india/qv)¬†for collective decision-making

-   December 2023: Conducted session on¬†[Role of Crypto in Public Goods](https://x.com/Atlantis_p2p/status/1731932427554116074)¬†at¬†[Interfaces](https://lu.ma/interfaces)¬†Unconference at the Indian Institute of Science

-   Through the year, we have published educational articles on our online publication¬†[Gulshan](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india)¬†on topics such as:

    -   [navigating challenges for regen founders](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india/navigating-regen-movement)
    -   [the role of inquiry in regen's future](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india/role-of-inquiry)
    -   [inspirations from nature for mechanism design](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india/mechanism-design)
    -   [the legacy of the Chipko Movement in India](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india/chipko)
    -   [key takeaways for India from the GreenPill book](https://paragraph.xyz/@greenpill-india/programmable-money)

# Challenges

Our ongoing challenge is community building. So far, all the activities have been driven by the core team. We are planning to scale the operations using the Impact Miner app, which can reward volunteers and contributors for their actions using the grant funding and, in return, help codify their impact onchain.

# Wins

The most rewarding part of running the chapter activities is introducing the affordances of blockchain technology to non-crypto audiences and explaining how the Lego blocks stack together for new solutions for some of the most complex challenges, from funding open-source software to climate action.

![](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/flex004/uploads/greenpill_hub/original/1X/d3ba63086425101831b109d3d4d76ea9a746bd0e.avif)

# Path Forward

GreenPill India aspires to create spaces where dialogues can flourish and debates can be hosted to bring code and culture together to challenge the status quo and build plural pathways for an equitable future.

The core team will continue to offer their time for the chapter with no expectation of compensation. We want to enable funding for volunteers and contributors who drive action on the ground. For this purpose, we will utilize the capital allocation workflow using the Impact Miner app from Atlantis.
We will continue using residual and new funds raised for the following:

-   Upcoming focus:¬†Expand the core group's subject matter expertise to new community members and enable them to scale independent projects, events, and activities
-   Use of funds:¬†Cost of logistics to host events. Incentivizing members with relevant skills to own and deliver curated bounties for delivering on chapter priorities using Impact Miner
-   Type of events:¬†Highly curated in-person experiences to introduce and apply regenerative concepts to fund and thrive public goods in India
-   Measuring success:¬†Quality of engagement, type of events, and number of artifacts produced as part of our communication and outreach

$CODEX is a revolutionary photosynthetic fintech platform, built on the ongoing, additional growth from "True" carbon negative neighborhood trees' offsets. Earn this carbon negative crypto token and stablecoin for your planting, care, maintenance, and stewardship of local trees. Seedlings, saplings, recently planted, or old growth, it doesn't matter...if it stores carbon, you can tokenize it.

project.title: ReFi The Hague Activation
project.description:
# Empowering The Hague with Web3
**ReFi The Hague is bringing the ReFi Web3 ecosystem to The Hague, connecting people with Web3 tools and knowledge.** 
We are building a community-centric ecosystem powered by equity tokens, a DAO, and a community marketplace, providing economic independence, community ownership, and sustainable initiatives. ReFi is revolutionizing how individuals and organizations in The Hague interact with the economy and environment by integrating Web3 technology. We offer residents a way to transition from traditional, destructive systems to a regenerative, community-driven future.
## Problem Statement
The Hague community faces a significant barrier: limited knowledge of Web3 features and insufficient access to the tools needed to engage effectively in this space. This lack of understanding hinders local adoption of innovative technologies and sustainable practices.
## Our Solution
We address this issue by:
- **Providing hands-on training** for setting up wallets and navigating Web3 interfaces.
- **Guiding users through the Celo network**, chosen for its alignment with our sustainability vision.
- **Deploying equity tokens and a DAO on Celo** to enable community co-ownership of sustainable projects and inclusive decision-making.
## Impact on the Celo Ecosystem
Our project is designed to:
- Expand the Celo user base in The Hague.
- Increase the number of transactions and wallet usage within the local community.
- Drive the growth and integration of Celo in real-world, sustainable applications.
## Our Journey
### January 2020
- Registered BT Equity & Viable Equity to manage tokenized sustainable projects.
- Registered Viable Community to support volunteer-driven sustainability and obtained ANBI status as a Public Benefit Organization.
- Adapted our legal framework to a steward-ownership model.
- Despite setbacks with pilot projects due to licensing issues, we continued to progress.
### March 2024
- Established ReFi The Hague as a local node during the ReFi DAO incubator program.
### August 2024
- Apply for GG21 Genesis and Real World Builders rounds.
- Continue developing on the Celo platform, hiring experts from the ReFi network, and cross-pollinating with other nodes and Web3 projects globally and locally.
### September 2024
- Map out The Hague‚Äôs Web3 space and establish connections.
- Finalize the legal setup for steward-ownership and DAO integration.
- Host our first educational event and publish our whitepaper and explanatory videos.
### October 2024
- Deploy Volunteer Interface 1.0.
- Launch the community marketplace.
- Mint equity tokens to support local sustainable projects.
### November 2024
- Launch the DAO and commence our AgriVoltaic pilot project.
## Focus Areas
### Community Building
- Engage The Hague‚Äôs residents by offering opportunities to contribute time, skills, and resources toward sustainability.
- Grow the ReFi The Hague community from 4 to 20 members and attract 100+ volunteers through local events and the Volunteer The Hague platform.
### Web3 Integration
- Receive expert input on our whitepaper from Web3 experts within the ReFi and Celo communities.
- Finalize and launch equity tokens and a community marketplace.
- Develop a DAO and additional (soulbound) tokens to facilitate transparent decision-making and empower community ownership.
### Web3 Awareness
- Educate 100+ local volunteers on Web3 through monthly training sessions and informative content on our YouTube channel.
### Collaborative Projects
- Launch our collaborative AgriVoltaics pilot project, allowing community members to co-own and benefit from sustainable food and energy production.
## Programs
### Volunteer Program
- Host volunteer coffee meetups to engage with new and existing volunteers from The Hague.
- Launch the Volunteer Portal 1.0, providing access to tools like Google Workspace, Slack, ClickUp, Figma, Canva, tutorials, and relevant documentation.
- Hold a strategic/governance meeting to establish OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) and timeline.
### Educational Program
- Host our first open educational event.
- Launch a YouTube channel to explain Web3 concepts and their relevance to our community.
### Sustainable Investment Program
- Mint and deploy the first 1,000 equity tokens on the Celo network, backed by ‚Ç¨1,000 in the holding‚Äôs bank account.
- Deploy the marketplace, allocating ‚Ç¨500 to stock it with sustainable items and services, and another ‚Ç¨500 to the liquidity pool for token sales.
- Test the marketplace by distributing 500 tokens to volunteers as a reward for their contributions.
## Challenges & Opportunities
Our main challenge lies in setting up Web3 tools, integrating them with real-life projects, and engaging local supporters in decision-making. However, The Hague's international, forward-thinking population and our established volunteer base position us for success.
## Support Us
To complete this stage of our Web3 development, we are seeking between ‚Ç¨2,500 and ‚Ç¨50,000 to cover expenses for expert advice, reviews, development tools, and deployment. These funds will flow back into the ReFi and Celo ecosystems, helping us finalize our infrastructure and operations with valuable input from within these networks.
## Key Milestones
- Finalized legal framework for steward-ownership, tokenization, and decision-making via DAO, connecting the NGO, Holding, and SPV.
- Completed development of Web3 tools (Tokens and DAO).
- Live local educational events.
```

metadata.title: ReFi The Hague Activation
metadata.description:
ReFi The Hague is a grassroots initiative bringing the principles of Regenerative Finance (ReFi) and the power of Web3 to the people of The Hague.
Our mission is to foster a regenerative, community-owned economy by creating tools, infrastructure, and learning opportunities that empower residents to co-create sustainable futures.

We‚Äôre building a local ecosystem where people can:

‚ôªÔ∏è Transact regeneratively through a community marketplace.

üå± Learn to use Web3 tools through hands-on, inclusive education.

üåû Co-own regenerative projects via equity tokens and DAO governance.

ü§ù Collaborate on real-world solutions like AgriVoltaics and circular economy initiatives.

We use the Celo blockchain and a steward-ownership legal model to ensure that value created within the community benefits the community.

üéØ 2025 Objectives & Milestones
‚úÖ 1. Launch Marketplace MVP
Goal: Launch a self-sustaining MVP of our community marketplace.

Impact: Facilitate decentralized exchange of local goods/services.

Metrics:

50+ items or services listed within the first 3 months.

100+ Celo-based transactions by end of Q3 2025.

Minimum 500 utility tokens distributed among contributors.

üåû 2. AgriVoltaics Pilot Project

Location: Wijdehorst Cooperative Permaculture Farm, Wassenaar (approx. 6.9 hectares)

Goal: Install a 6x20m (120m¬≤) agrivoltaic nursery to support the farm‚Äôs food forest and permaculture systems, while generating solar energy for on-site drying and cooling of farm products.

Impact: Enhance climate resilience, promote regenerative agriculture, and empower community participation in sustainable food systems.

Metrics:

6.9 hectares of regenerative farmland supported through strategic shading, enabling healthier seedling development and improving climate adaptability across the farm.

120m¬≤ agrivoltaic nursery providing dual benefits of crop growth and solar power.

Energy used on-site for drying and cooling farm products, reducing waste and improving local food preservation.

50+ active cooperative members and contributors, including volunteers and equity token holders.

Surplus seedlings sold to visitors, encouraging sustainable gardening and community involvement.

Pilot operational by Q4 2025, with monthly impact reporting and open data sharing.

üß≠ 3. DAO & Co-Decision Framework
Goal: Finalize DAO structure & governance tools integrated with our steward-ownership framework.

Impact: Enable equitable participation in key decisions.

Metrics:

At least 3 active governance proposals voted on by community.

100+ DAO participants (members with voting rights).

Launch DAO portal and public documentation before end-2025.

üåç 4. Expand Educational Access & Awareness
Goal: Onboard newcomers into the Web3 and ReFi space, especially from non-technical or underserved communities.

Impact: Create a ripple effect of understanding, empowerment, and adoption.

Metrics:

Host 3+ educational workshops in 2025.

Reach 500+ participants through in-person and online sessions.

Distribute 200+ Proof of Attendance tokens (PoAPs) to attendees.

ü§ù 5. Grow Community & Partnerships
Goal: Deepen our local network of volunteers, residents, and regenerative stakeholders.

Impact: Strengthen collaborative efforts and cross-pollinate ideas.

Metrics:

Expand core contributor base from 8 to 20 members.

Engage 200+ volunteers via platforms like Volunteer The Hague.

Form at least 5 new strategic partnerships (locally and internationally).

üß∞ 6. Project Toolkit & Selection Criteria
Goal: Launch a transparent framework for community-driven project proposals.

Impact: Empower citizens to initiate and fund their own regenerative projects.

Metrics:

Publish selection criteria and toolkit by Q3 2025.

Fund at least 2 community-initiated projects within the year.

Create open-source documentation for project onboarding.

üìà Strengthening the Celo Ecosystem
We actively contribute to Celo‚Äôs real-world adoption by:

Onboarding new users and wallets in the Netherlands.

Building our Marketplace, governance tools, utility- and equity tokens on Celo.

Demonstrating use cases of ReFi that link directly to sustainable practices and local economies.

Metrics:

500+ new Celo wallets created locally in 2025.

1,000+ Celo transactions from our DAO, marketplace, and token interactions.

5+ ecosystem developers or contributors actively collaborating with ReFi The Hague.

üåø Vision for the Future
We envision The Hague as a leader in regenerative innovation ‚Äî where communities own the means to sustain themselves, where technology and nature are allies, and where everyone has a voice in shaping a better world.

project.title: GreenPill Ottawa
project.description:
üå± Turning regen philosophy into real-world action one person at a time üå± üîópowered by crypto, inspired by human potential üåé

Based in Ottawa, Canada, we've already achieved many things, including hosting educational workshops, creating a 'getting started in web3' guide, hosting community meetups, partnering with other web3 protocols to support local impact and donating to local causes.

Our upcoming plans involve continuing to run meetups, and workshops, and collaborate with local web3 groups. We are seeking funding to sustain our chapter's growth and support the larger GPN ecosystem.

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GQM4s9qWoAMf_CM?format=jpg&name=large)

Since GG20, we have:

- alongside OperationWebTree, we purchased 160 white pine seedlings and coordinated with 8+ community partners to help with reforestation in our region.


![image](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/flex004/uploads/greenpill_hub/original/1X/de3374f687acc990878821e9925fac7e4e2de40e.jpeg)

- We co-hosted an artist onboarding event with Eepvers where we lead the onboarding workshop. We gave out .0015 eth to all who created their first wallet so that they could explore onchain.

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GQM4h6rWcAADZmU?format=jpg&name=large)

In the last year we have:

hosted a regenerative crypto + greenpill presentation with the Nimiq Community (https://www.nimiq.com/) exploring DePIN, how web3 tools can help foster decentralized collectives, support local communities and more.

was a community partner and speaker at Innovator and Creative Social - discussed the power of crypto in coordination, the GreenPill Network, gitcoin and other regen web3 tooling (https://lu.ma/InnovatorCreativeSocial-Denver2024)

Partnering with Silvi for #OperationWebTree (reforestation project) to grow and plant White Pines in the Ottawa region (https://x.com/greenpillottawa/status/1760784630628692049?s=20)

Donated to web3 communities:

Impact Summit (Nigeria)

Japan earthquake relief

Denver GP summit

Donated to local non-profits:

ecology Ottawa

Parkdale Food Market x2

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GBqPMxKWYAEdENV?format=jpg&name=medium)

Continued to Incubate RootedLABs + bring web3 tooling into the project

‚ÅÉ    Urban (Shipping container) engineering specs complete for unit 1 - to be minted on-chain

‚ÅÉ    Founding member nfts distributed

‚ÅÉ    Will be distributing on-chain credentials to students who help

To date we have also accomplished the following:

- Hosted educational workshops and events, helping first-time web3 users earn their first bit of crypto for successfully setting up their EVM wallets and learning how to use them.

![image](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/F3gEi1sWUAEpH8s?format=jpg&name=large)

- Developed a comprehensive 'getting started in web3' guide and resource booklet, offering step-by-step instructions to assist individuals in securely establishing, funding, and using their wallets to explore web3. Most attendees were artists and public goods-focused individuals.

- Donated to Ecology Ottawa, which supports tree-planting initiatives in the city.

- Wrote the 'Touch Grass' guide for V2 GreenPill.

- Collaborated with PizzaDAO to organize an in-person Ottawa Bitcoin pizza day, providing practical demonstrations of DAO functionality and organization (attended by over 150 people).

- Co-hosted an official side event for EthWaterloo with PizzaDAO, where more than 150 participants networked around the theme of Public Goods, while also mentoring 5 hackers during the hackathon.

- Hosted an introductory workshop on decentralized social media, led by our Chapter Lead.

- Ran an intro into defi and web3 workshop at : https://growthweeklive.com/growth-week-2021 (https://growthweeklive.com/growth-week-2021)

- Are incubating RootedLABs to help spearhead the establishment of a network of decentralized Urban Farms and agriculture AI solutions (since July '23)

These accomplishments showcase our dedication to community-building, education and onboarding within web3, as well as our focus on making a positive impact in our local community..

project.title: Anu Initiative
project.description:
Anu Initiative - Web3 in service of Mother Nature

üå±WEBSITE: ANUINITIATIVE.ORG
üå±INTRO VIDEO: YOUTUBE
üå±HOW DOES IT WORK?: YOUTUBE

üå±Who are we?

Anu Initiative is a Company Limited by Guarantee (not-for-profit) incorporated in Dublin, Ireland. It was founded by nature lovers to create a positive impact on the planet.

We are NOT another carbon credits based organization! We aim on delivering real, tangible ecological impact.

üå±The Problem and the Solution 

The global environmental crisis, characterized by unprecedented levels of biodiversity loss, deforestation, climate change, soil degradation, and other challenges, poses a pressing issue for humanity.

Traditional fundraising methods, plagued by issues such as lack of transparency, high fees, and a deficit of trust, often hinder effective efforts to combat these problems.

We designed a platform that connects the donor with the impact generated by their generosity that provides full transparency and accessibility to track all donations and contributions to the Anu Initiative‚Äôs Treasury all the way to Actual Impact generated by our trusty Impact Partners.

üå±Let's take the initiative!

metadata.title: Anu Initiative (ReFi)
metadata.description:
**Anu Initiative - Trusty Tech in service of Mother Nature**

**Website:** https://anuinitiative.org

**Github:** https://github.com/Anu-Initiative

**KarmaHQ:** https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/anu-initiative-refi-1

**üå±Who are we?**

Anu Initiative is a Company Limited by Guarantee (not-for-profit) incorporated in Dublin, Ireland. It was founded by nature lovers to create a positive impact on the planet.

We are NOT another carbon credits based organization! We aim on delivering real, tangible ecological impact.

**üî¥Problems Addressed**

1. The global environmental crisis, characterized by unprecedented levels of biodiversity loss, deforestation, climate change, soil degradation, and other challenges, poses a pressing issue for humanity.

2. Traditional fundraising methods often suffer from issues such as lack of transparency, high operating costs, and a lack of trust, which can limit the effectiveness of efforts to address these challenges.

‚ùóLack of transparency and trust - It can be difficult for donors to know how their donations are being used, how much was used for Impact vs. Operations, etc.

‚ùóMiddlemen and overhead cost - A portion of donations may be used to cover operational and administrative expenses.

‚ùóPotential for fraud - There have been many cases of charity organizations misusing funds or being outright scams.

‚ùóLimited control - Once a donation is made, the donor typically has no further say in how the funds are used or distributed.

‚ùóLimited or no connection with impact generated - Once a donation is made, the donor typically isn‚Äôt made aware of the actual impact generated by their generosity.

**üí° Our Solution**

‚úÖWe designed a platform that connects the donor with the impact generated by their generosity that provides full transparency and accessibility to track all donations and contributions to the Anu Initiative‚Äôs Treasury all the way to Actual Impact generated by our trusty Impact Partners.

‚úÖBy integrating these solutions, Anu Initiative can help overcome the traditional challenges of environmental fundraising and create a robust, transparent, and effective mechanism for environmental impact.

‚úÖBlockchain Technology for Transparency - Utilize blockchain tech to track donations from the moment they are made until they are spent, and moreover, all the way down to the impact generated. This ensures that donors can see exactly where their money is going and how it is being used, addressing the transparency and trust issues.

‚úÖDirect Impact Tracking - Develop a system that connects donations to specific projects and outcomes in a live manner. For each project funded, there should be a clear set of expected results, and donors and the public should receive reports on the project's progress and impact. Funded projects should be displayed on a public dashboard.

‚úÖReduce Overhead with Technology - Automate various administrative and operational tasks using software to reduce the need for middlemen and cut down on overhead costs. This allows a larger portion of donations to go directly to environmental projects.

‚úÖEngagement and Feedback Loop - Create a platform where donors can vote on projects they want to support, providing them with control over how their donations are used and fostering a deeper connection with the impact generated.

‚úÖImpact Investment Fund - Establish a fund to invest in startups and technologies that provide ecological benefits, with profits being reinvested into the Anu Initiative‚Äôs projects.

‚úÖFeedback and Adaptation - Implement a feedback mechanism where donors, partners, and beneficiaries can suggest improvements to the Anu Initiative‚Äôs processes, ensuring that the organization remains responsive and adaptable to the needs of the environment and its stakeholders.

**üå±Roadmap:**

**Administrative:**
1. Complete Charity Registration with the Charities Regulator (Ireland) - (in progress)

Currently we have 4x Charity Trustees and 1x Charity 
Current Charity Trustees:
- Jimi Cohen
- John Ruth
- Saray Levi
- Drew Simon

We need at least 2x more Trustees

2.  Register as a Virtual Asset Service Provider with the Central Bank of Ireland (not yet started - pending Charity registration)

Partnership to be formalised with KYC Bot.

3. Formal partnership a main Blockchain provider like Celo / Optimism / Arbitrum, etc.

**Development:**
1. Finish the Smart Contract professional review (in progress)

https://github.com/Anu-Initiative/smart-contracts 

2. Finish front-end design and development for the App (in progress)

https://github.com/Anu-Initiative/front-end

3. Finish developing the Chainlink Oracle (not yet started).

Go-live target date: Q1 of 2025.

**Supporting Study:**
- Summary: https://www.coindesk.com/opinion/2024/07/17/philanthropys-blockchain-uptake-is-slow-but-future-is-bright/

- Full Research Report: https://forum.anuinitiative.org/t/an-inquiry-into-transparent-and-accountable-giving/90

**Open-Source Commitment**
- Anu Initiative is committed to **open-source principles**, ensuring transparency and innovation within the Web3 ecosystem. Our platform operates under the **GNU General Public License (GPL) Version 2, June 1991**, which allows any charity or community to adopt, modify, and extend our codebase. This encourages collaboration and participation from developers, environmental activists, and blockchain enthusiasts.

**License Information:**
- All core components, including our smart contracts and platform, are licensed under the GNU General Public License Version 2
- This ensures that any modifications or distributions of our code remain open-source and benefit the broader community.

üå±Let's take the initiative!

project.description:
## Node Overview

### Node History

ReFi Atl√°ntico is a local node of ReFi DAO Located at the Colombian Caribbean, established in February 2024 we are the newest Colombian local node, our mission is transforming traditional financial systems through Regenerative Finance (ReFi). Despite being a relatively young organization, we have achieved several important milestones in a short  period:

- **February 2024**: Establishment of ReFi Atl√°ntico and formation of key alliances with local communities.
    
   
    
- **March 2024**: Launch of our first educational programs and workshops on regenerative financial practices.
    
   
    
- **June 2024**: Implementation of the first pilot economic regeneration projects in the region.

[]()

### Impact

In just a few months, we have trained over 200 community and business leaders in sustainable and regenerative practices. Our initial projects have begun to significantly improve local ecosystems and social structures. We have a network of alliances that includes local governments, NGOs, and private companies, facilitating the adoption of our initiatives. Additionally, we have received donations from Prezenti Grants and are committed to further contributing to the ReFi ecosystem in Colombia.





### Fundraising and Legal Structure

ReFi Atl√°ntico operates as a nonprofit organization. To date, we have raised funds through private donations and small grants, allowing us to receive both national and international funding and collaborations.

### Challenges and Opportunities

**Challenges**:

- **Sustainable Funding**: Securing continuous funding sources to maintain and expand our operations.
- **Adoption of Regenerative Practices**: Overcoming initial resistance to change in some communities and sectors.

**Opportunities**:

- **Network Growth**: Expanding our network of collaborators and strategic partners.
- **Technological Innovation**: Implementing emerging technologies such as blockchain to improve transparency and efficiency in our projects.


### Goals and Opportunities with Potential Funds

With the potential funds raised this quarter, ReFi Atl√°ntico aims to achieve the following key milestones and opportunities:

- **Expansion of Educational Programs**: Expand our workshops and training programs to reach more communities and leaders.
- **New Pilot Projects**: Implement additional economic regeneration projects in different areas of the  Atlantico region.
- **Infrastructure Improvement**: Invest in technology and resources to improve the efficiency and reach of our initiatives. We want to start the develpment of our own marketplace Web3 page.Budget and Fundraising Goal

### Budget and Fundraising Goal

To achieve these objectives, we estimate a realistic budget of $24,000 USD, with a fundraising goal of $14,000 USD through this grant. These funds will be used for program expansion, project implementation, and infrastructure improvement.

**Product Development and Launch:**

- Development costs: $5,000
- Marketing and launch expenses: $2,000
- Total: $7,000
1. **Community Growth and Events:**
    - Event hosting and logistics: $1,500
    - Outreach programs and materials: $1,500
    - Total: $3,000
2. **Educational Initiatives:**
    - Instructor and Program development: $2,000
    - Workshop and training sessions: $2,000
    - Total: $4,000

**Overall Fundraising Goal: $14,000**

answers.answer:
RoadMap and Plans to Utilise Celo Ecosystem.

B<>rder/ess will leverage Celo Dev Tooling resources to provide education and inspiration resources aimed at producing young people every quarter who are competent in building solutions on CELO, and we‚Äôve created a strategy to make this possible in 4 Phases;

Goal 1: B<>rder/ess Web3 Tech Clubs and Integrations (Community & User Education Strategy on interacting with CELO ecosystem)

Goal 2: CELO Themed Developer Programme and Dev Bootcamp (Education)

Goal 3: CELO Themed Hackathons and Event (Deployment)

Goal 4: Certification and Business Dev Mentorship (Go to Market strategies)

This strategy gives CELO;

Builders
Users
Products
Marketing
Updates and contributions to CELO deployment documentation and Repos.
Borderless Physical Hub

A developer‚Äôs hub to produce at least 20 young students in Africa every quarter skilled in writing Smart Contracts on CELO with Rust & JavaScript.

They‚Äôd gain knowledge of CELO, and Interface designs, and gain experience in building with CELO SDKs.

Every quarter, Borderless CELO Event A Dev/Finance Event

Our events will showcase usable products built on CELO, attract users, award devs, and increase transactions, including ticket payments, NFT claims, on-chain gaming and more.

B<>rder/ess Web3 Tech CLubs

B<>rder/ess has Tech Clubs in 6 Universities in Nigeria, we could run the same activity we‚Äôre running in Port-Harcourt in those universities, using the same budget.

If you‚Äôd like to start with both the Port-Harcourt location and another city/state, we can run the same strategy below through our tech clubs in that State.


ROADMAP AND STRATEGY

1. Product Discovery (Dev & Small Business Meet-ups)		
The goal here is to identify from local businesses what solutions they would like developed, this way we avoid the problem of building solutions small businesses can‚Äôt use.

2. Focus Group style meetups plus User education
Narrow down 3 products that will be developed during the BootCamp sessions.

Gives us ready users of the products when they are ready.
Provides a quicker roadmap to deployment and user acquisitions.
Provides available Testers and Users

3. Phase 2 Cipher Sessions and Boot Camp
Physical and Virtual training and DevRel sessions.

4. Monthly ‚ÄúCELO Stars‚Äù Meetups
Monthly Developer Podcasts sessions


5. Marketing materials and campaigns
We deploy referral-based strategies like how exchanges have listing bounties. If developers are referred to take our program and go through with it, the referrals earn rewards.

We‚Äôd run community marketing activities, thread contests and more.

project.title: Borderless
project.description:
Borderless is a non-for-profit tech arm of Crypto Smart that aims to train at least 100 African tech developers each year to build Web2 and Web3 products. We do this by establishing physical hubs, hosting events, providing training, offering mentorship, and launching tech projects.

Physical hubs: B<>rder/ess will have physical hubs in several African countries that provide a space for developers to learn, collaborate, and network.

The first was opened in November 2022 in Port-Harcourt Nigeria and the next will be opened at the University Of Port-Harcourt Nigeria.

Events: B<>rder/ess hosts a variety of events, such as hackathons, meetups, and conferences. These events provide developers with opportunities to learn new skills, meet new people, and share their work, the last event was held in November 2022 in Port-Harcourt Nigeria. See the highlights here https://borderless.cryptosmartnow.io/event

Training: B<>rder/ess offers a variety of training programs, both online and in person. These programs cover a wide range of topics, including web development, blockchain development, and data science.

Mentorship: B<>rder/ess pairs developers with experienced mentors. These mentors provide guidance and support to help developers reach their full potential.

project.title: Zoa
project.description:
The Retirement Savings dApp on Celo is a decentralized application designed to empower individuals to manage their retirement savings with transparency, security, and ease.

 Built on the Celo blockchain, our dApp leverages the advantages of decentralized finance (DeFi) to provide users with a robust, trustless, and efficient way to save and grow their retirement funds. 

This project aims to democratize access to retirement savings tools, ensuring that individuals from all economic backgrounds can plan for their future with confidence.


Roadmap


Phase 1: Initial Launch
MVP Development: Develop and launch the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) with core functionalities.
Beta Testing: Conduct a closed beta testing phase with select users to gather feedback and make improvements.


Phase 2: Feature Expansion
Enhanced Investment Options: Integrate additional DeFi protocols and investment options.
User Experience Enhancements: Improve the user interface based on feedback and add new features such as goal tracking and personalized recommendations.


Phase 3: Community and Governance
Community Building: Foster a strong community around the dApp with forums, events, and educational resources.
Decentralized Governance: Implement community governance features, allowing users to propose and vote on changes to the platform.


Phase 4: Global Expansion
Localization: Localize the dApp for different languages and regions to cater to a global user base.
Partnerships: Establish partnerships with financial institutions, DeFi projects, and other relevant entities to enhance the platform's offerings and reach.

Conclusion

The Retirement Savings dApp on Celo is a groundbreaking solution that aims to make retirement planning accessible, transparent, and efficient for everyone. 

By leveraging the power of the Celo blockchain and DeFi, we are providing users with a secure and user-friendly platform to save for their future. Join us in revolutionizing retirement savings and ensuring a financially secure future for all.

project.title: GreenPill CIV
project.description:
**Chapter description**

We are the Green Pill Local Chapter of C√¥te d'Ivoire (GreenPill CIV), founded on 20/06/2024. We are dedicated to promoting inclusive development through technology and effective collaboration among people from all sectors of Ivorian society to carry out regenerative projects.
Our mission is to promote and implement actions and technological tools within local communities to address environmental and social challenges in C√¥te d'Ivoire, adopting a collaborative and regenerative approach. We focus on:

- Popularizing and taking ownership of social issues by promoting education and access to information to fight against inequalities.

- Raising awareness and combating environmental issues such as pollution of natural and urban areas and reforestation in rural areas.

- Encouraging and facilitating cooperation among stakeholders for local action through technological tools such as social media, blockchain, and AI.

In summary, we aim to implement sustainable and innovative solutions to improve the quality of life for the populations of Ivorian localities through regenerative technologies and the tools offered by the crypto-economy, with a perspective of inclusive development.

In the Ivorian context, where Web 3 and blockchain are often seen solely through the lens of speculation, it seemed necessary, before taking any action, to raise local awareness on topics related to inclusive development and regenerative crypto-economy. Furthermore, we needed a base of individuals likely to join our Chapter.
Thus, we launched the community ‚ÄúHabitants d‚ÄôInternet‚Äù, in english ‚ÄúInternet Dwellers.‚Äù This community aims to connect members, facilitate discussions on current and societal issues, and ultimately foster collective action that will impact our society.

**Main project: Habitants d'internet V2**

Our community was created in June as a debate platform on WhatsApp voice chat. Within a few weeks and through several debates, we successfully gathered more than 200 Dwellers.
However, the success of the platform has presented several challenges. The first is WhatsApp's limit, which restricts the number of participants in a discussion group to 32 people simultaneously. While this has not prevented us from gathering nearly 50 people in audio after each debate, this limit hinders active community participation.
Moreover, having discussed with several members, we found that many are eager to contribute to Green Pill CIV's impact mission.
In response to these challenges, we have thought of a solution:
Transform Habitant d‚ÄôInternet into a Startup Society. This means creating a digital community model designed to provide real-world value and reward the most active members. This Startup Society will be a means to unite members around impactful projects, test governance models, and offer community benefits (from our partners and technologically).
To do that, we decided to move from WhatsApp to Telegram, adopting the benefits of the TON blockchain to enhance our connectivity and engagement. However, we needed a way to recognize and reward the efforts of our members who work tirelessly towards our common goals.
In this context, the idea of $DJAI was born. Named after the vibrant spirit of the ‚ÄúHabitant d‚ÄôInternet‚Äù, $DJAI is not just a token but a symbol of recognition and encouragement of community action. It embodies our collective commitment to making a social impact through the power of Web3 technologies.
$DJAI is designed to reward members for actions that align with our community‚Äôs mission. Whether it's organizing a local event, leading a discussion on a crucial topic, or developing a beneficial project for society, each impactful action deserves $DJAI tokens.
What makes $DJAI unique is its focus on empowerment rather than profit. Holders of $DJAI tokens will enjoy exclusive benefits within our network and with our partners. Imagine receiving discounts on educational courses, gaining early access to innovative technological solutions, or even having a voice in community decision-making processes. $DJAI makes these possibilities real.
Our Vision for $DJAI is simple yet profound: to create a self-sustaining ecosystem where every member‚Äôs contribution is valued and rewarded. $DJAI will serve as the cornerstone of this ecosystem, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. As we integrate Web3 technologies into our operations, $DJAI will be the key to unlocking new opportunities for collaboration and growth.


**What we have done :**
June 20: First Meet-up with Green Pill.
June 20: Launch of the Habitants d‚ÄôInternet platform by the Green Pill CIV chapter and launch of the first series of debates.
June 23: Debate: ‚ÄúMany Young People, Not Enough Jobs‚Äù ‚Äì An online discussion with 50 participants on job opportunities in the Ivorian market and professional opportunities offered by new technologies, particularly social media and the Web 3 environment.
June 30: Debate: ‚ÄúLGBTQ+ Movement and African Society‚Äù ‚Äì An online discussion with an audience of 52 on the social treatment of LGBTQ+ individuals in the African context, followed by idea exchanges and reflections on how to move towards a more inclusive society.
July 11: Collaboration for the Afro Babi Web3 event with Blockchain for Africa (X: @BlockchainForA2) ‚Äì An educational event on blockchain and practical applications of Web 3 technologies in the African context.
July 21: Conference: ‚ÄúMental Health in C√¥te d‚ÄôIvoire‚Äù ‚Äì An online exchange with 68 participants featuring mental health experts Arthur Attha and Emissah Kouassi, who answered community questions and provided advice on maintaining mental well-being and thriving in an increasingly fast-paced, connected, and unpredictable environment.

**Future Plans:**

August 18: ‚ÄúCausons Discutons‚Äù event with Habitants in partnership with KCA (Instagram: @kidsconnectafrica)

August 10 and 11: Habitants‚Äô Olympics, an in person event to reward participants for their engagement and strengthen community spirit through socio-environmental actions with a regenerative impact.

**Our Roadmap :** https://app.charmverse.io/greenpill-network/road-map-5576844155191034


**Conclusion**
In the ever-evolving landscape of the internet, Habitants d‚ÄôInternet aims to be a testament to the power of community impact. With the introduction of $DJAI, we are not just creating a token, but nurturing a movement‚Äîa movement where every action, no matter how small, contributes to the common good.

Join us on this exciting journey as we harness the potential of technology and web3 to empower our members and transform our community into a model of social impact and innovation. Together, we can achieve more, create more, and inspire more.

**About Us :**

https://x.com/greenpillciv
https://www.instagram.com/greenpill_civ/

project.title: ReFi Costa Rica: Regenerating our Optimism
project.description:
![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_webp,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F78c67f18-fd76-4f28-8577-354cd792cb3d_1024x362.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")

## Welcome to ReFi Costa Rica!  Join us in the adventure of reconnecting all the people  regenerating our country, with our capital city San Jos√© at the center of a collaborative movement to transform Costa Rica into a ReFi Lab for the World.

For our üéâ **One Year Anniversary as a ReFi DAO node** üéâ and our **fourth Gitcoin Round** we need your support to: 

+ Keep organizing our in person ReFi meetups at least once a month in San Jos√©, in collaboration with Cripto Cantina and Asoblockchain Costa Rica. 

+ Keep organizing our biweekly virtual Regenerative Finance Meetups on Zoom

+  Keep running and improving our ReFi Incubator Program experiment

+ Keep experimenting with Hypercerts to track our impact around Costa Rica


## Project Overview:

The ReFi Costa Rica Local Node project is dedicated to advancing regenerative finance and decentralized technology adoption in Costa Rica. With a special focus on areas beyond the capital city, San Jos√©, the project aims to foster a thriving ecosystem that promotes sustainable development, economic empowerment, and community engagement.

![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fd2ad4fd8-761f-42c5-9489-c5441891cb2f_1024x683.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")


## Project Goals and Impact:

+ _Local Engagement and Sustainable Development:_ The project seeks to introduce regenerative finance principles by organizing events and workshops, it aims to showcase how decentralized technologies can drive sustainable economic growth while preserving the local environment and culture. This includes the support for emerging and new ReFi projects and collaborative businesses via our Incubator Program.
+ _Regional Empowerment:_ Through regional events the project aims to empower local communities with innovative financial solutions. These solutions can align with regenerative practices, leading to the creation of sustainable livelihoods, businesses, and initiatives that benefit the region's unique characteristics.
+ _Community Collaboration:_ Collaborating with local partners, the project aims to facilitate collaboration among community members, organizations, and universities. By fostering a sense of shared purpose, it encourages the exchange of ideas, resources, and knowledge, leading to the creation of impactful regenerative projects.
+ _Inclusive Governance:_ In collaboration with [Cambiatus](https://www.cambiatus.com/), the project is committed to co-designing a governance framework that reflects the principles of regenerative finance. This framework aims to ensure inclusivity, transparency, and community-driven decision-making, enhancing the long-term sustainability of the local node.
+ _National and Global Integration:_ The past project's vinculation with bigger events and organizations such as the [Blockchain Jungle](https://blockchainjungle.com/) event and the Blockchain Week Costa Rica 2023 by [AsoBlockchain](https://asoblockchain.org/) showcases the country's dedication to regenerative finance practices. 
+ _Educational Advancement:_ Through collaborative master classes with [ULACIT](https://www.ulacit.ac.cr/) and [VIU](https://www.universidadviu.com/) universities, the project strives to educate students about the intersection of regenerative finance and decentralized technologies. By nurturing a skilled workforce, it aims to empower young minds to contribute to the sustainable development of Costa Rica's economy.
+ Collaborative Businesses incubation and promotion, via our experimental Incubator Program to support local initiatives applying and creating blockchain technology for impact, with special focus on regeneration, RWA (real world assets) and multichain implementations with ZKP, AA, Causal AI.

![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/F_HCv26XEAA6grB.jpg "group shot refi costa rica")


 
## Budget Breakdown:

_**35% Event Planning and Execution:**_ Funding will be allocated to organize city and regional events, covering venue rentals, promotional materials, and logistical expenses. Includes monthly crypto meetups in partnership with AsoBlockchain, and the II Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica.

_**30% Incubator Program:**_ Organizing a second cohort of our Incubator Program (online)

_**10% Educational Workshops:**_ Costs associated with conducting master classes in collaboration with universities to educate the local community about blockchain technology. 

_**25% Governance Co-Design:**_ Allocation for collaborative efforts with Cambiatus to co-design an effective governance structure for the local node. 




## Expected Outcomes:
+ Increased awareness and adoption of blockchain technology.
+ Strengthening of the emerging ReFi projects and Collaborative Businesses ecosystem in Costa Rica
+ Stronger blockchain community engagement through San Jos√© events and collaborations with AsoBlockchain.
+ Enhanced knowledge and understanding of blockchain technology through educational master classes.
+ Well-defined and inclusive governance framework for the ReFi Costa Rica Local Node in collaboration with Cambiatus.

>**We invite you to be a part of this transformative journey by contributing to our campaign**. Your contribution will directly impact the growth and success of the ReFi Costa Rica Local Node and its endeavors. Together, we can drive regeneration, education, and innovation in Costa Rica's blockchain ecosystem.




## The amazing people behind ReFi San Jos√©

Behind this campaign there is a group of motivated, seasoned and committed founders with years of experience in Climate Change, community conservation, regenerative practices, community building, innovation, impact, blockchain technology, fundraising; and deeply connected with corporate, academic, government, civil and grassroots organizations in Costa Rica and Latam.

**Core Team Members**

1. Karla C√≥rdoba Brenes, Cambiatus Co-Founder, Asoblockchain President / Community Building, content creation, Social Currencies and DAOs co-design
2. Danibelle Gennety, Diamante Bridge Collective / Community Building
3. Ronny Castillo, Gaia Impact / Fundaci√≥n Madre Tierra Verde, investment vehicles codesign, funding strategies, tokenomics.  
4. Melissa Rivera Abarca, Fundaci√≥n Madre Tierra Verde / innovation and community building.
5. Ranulfo Paiva Sobrinho, Cambiatus Co-Founder / Community Building, Social Currencies and DAOs co-design
6. Randall Sabor√≠o, Diamante Bridge Collective / eco-villages and local markets
7. Pedro Garc√≠a, Sendero-Jard√≠n de Lolita / Community Building, culture

And the more than 60 regen people that join us in our Telegram Group. You can join us too [here!](https://t.me/reficostarica)


## **Join us in regenerating our optimism and making a meaningful difference!**

![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_webp,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F82b0072e-a1c5-46b7-9433-963aa7c74fbe_1024x683.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")


## **Proof of Impact**

Take a look at the events and other activities supported and organized by ReFi Costa Rica since April 2023 in this document:  [‚ÄúReFi Costa Rica Proof of Impact 2023-2024‚Äù](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1gLRm0VvumgzGk7rdx7NFYA2pF-2Pcen-sfW0HlnOcU8/edit?usp=sharing)

answers.question: Intro and socials of other team members or core contributors associated with the organisation?

answers.answer:
The Celo Africa DAO has supported the Celo ecosystem through 3 different focus areas.

1. The incubator program. The Celo Africa DAO has established an incubator program to nurture and support early-stage projects built on the Celo blockchain. This program provides entrepreneurs and developers with the necessary resources, mentorship, and funding opportunities to transform their innovative ideas into fully functional dApps. The incubator focuses on projects that align with Celo's mission of financial inclusion and sustainability, helping to expand the ecosystem by fostering the next generation of impactful blockchain solutions in Africa. These projects are further recommended to Celo Camp for further scaling and development. Some of our cohort graduates have launched on Minipay.

2. Developer Talent. To drive innovation and growth within the Celo ecosystem, the Celo Africa DAO places a strong emphasis on attracting, developing, and retaining top developer talent. The DAO organizes monthly code jams (technical workshops), mini-hackathons, and workshops aimed at equipping developers with the skills needed to build dApps on the Celo platform. By creating a robust pipeline of skilled developers, the DAO ensures that the Celo ecosystem has the technical expertise necessary to scale and evolve, particularly in the African context where local solutions are most impactful. Additionally, these monthly code jams have been supporting BWC(build with Celo) hackathons to get the most out of them, and the results and metrics have been impressive. Most of the promising projects are forwarded to the incubator program and Celo Camp

3.  Community Awareness & Brand Visibility. Celo Africa DAO actively works to raise awareness of the Celo brand and its mission across Africa. To amplify Celo's presence, the DAO has partnered with and sponsored major Web3 events across the continent. These high-profile events provide a platform to showcase Celo‚Äôs innovative solutions to a wider audience, including developers, entrepreneurs, and blockchain enthusiasts. By being visible on these big stages, Celo Africa DAO not only increases adoption of the Celo platform but also positions Celo as a key player in the African Web3 landscape. This strategy strengthens the ecosystem's reputation and fosters a deeper connection with the community, driving engagement and advocacy for Celo's mission of financial inclusion and social impact.

Our roadmap for the Q3 & Q4 2024 will include:
1.  Expanding Community Engagement i.e. Community Events & Meetups, University Partnerships, and Sponsorship of Major Web3 Conferences:
2. Strengthening Developer Talent & Ecosystem Growth i.e. Hackathons & Innovation Challenges
3.  Incubating and Scaling Impactful Projects i.e. Incubator Cohorts and Ecosystem Collaboration.

project.title: Celo Africa DAO
project.description:
Celo Africa DAO is a community of builders and developers committed to advancing the growth and adoption of the CELO blockchain across Africa. 

Celo Africa DAO's focus is centred on three main areas:
1. Incubator Program: Supporting early-stage founders across the continent with resources, mentorship, and guidance.

2. Developer Engagement: Attracting and nurturing developer talent to build innovative solutions on the Celo platform, acting as a Funnel for projects joining the Celo ecosystem.

3. Brand Visibility: Enhancing the visibility and recognition of the Celo brand throughout Africa.

answers.question: Intro and socials of other team members or core contributors associated with the organisation?

answers.answer:
In Season 0 (June ‚Äò23 - December ‚Äò23), we developed the foundation for Celo network in Europe. We deployed resources such as the¬†[Celo EU website](https://www.celodao.eu/),¬†which attracted 5000+ visits, created a¬†[Celo Ecosystem Report,](https://docsend.com/view/yrb3tzt9kepfc38r)¬†and published 10+ hours of high-quality videos, including a mini-documentary. CELO EU co-hosted 14 events with 2,000+ attendees, represented Celo, and spoke at 25+ events. Through our 3 co-programs (RefiDAO, Take Off & Casa Celo) - we engaged 100+ builders. Besides this, we‚Äôve also kickstarted the Celo Governance Development Sprint. Our efficient management of Season 0‚Äôs budget enabled us to return 27% surplus funds of 120,000 CELO to the community fund. 

In Season 1 (February ‚Äò24 - June '24), We‚Äôve doubled down on the successful elements of Season 0. We launched a community-led conference to shape the future of Celo by bringing together 150 key stakeholders in Berlin. Alongside this, we've supported more than 5+ European meetups hosted 2 meetups attracting 150+ attendees. We are planning further collaboration at ETHCC ‚Äò24 by dedicating a track for Public Goods and highlighting projects that contribute to the ecosystem. In addition to this, we‚Äôve represented Celo during ETHGlobal, DAS, ETHDam, and about 15+ side events while creating content for this experience. We‚Äôve also developed 2 scripts for a mini-documentary, which are being produced. We‚Äôve also assisted Casa Celo Madrid in hosting 2 events with around 70+ participants. To focus on growing our BD efforts, we‚Äôve connected with around 25+ investors and are enhancing our database to 100+ high-quality entries. Lastly, we‚Äôve contributed to creating a startup database for CeloPG containing 150+ 
operational startups.

In season 2 (July 2024 - December 2024), Celo EU will accelerate Celo‚Äôs growth through Events and Community Development, Ecosystem Support, and Content Production and Storytelling. We will organize an online Celo Gather event, sponsor four local European events, and support Celo Africa DAO and KohCelo at ETH Safari and DevCon. We'll host three online workshops on MiCA, CEL2, and the Superchain ecosystem. Our ecosystem support includes creating three educational resources, expanding our investor database by 20 entries, and exploring institutional collaborations. Content production will feature two new Builder‚Äôs Story episodes on Minipay, a mini-series at EthSafari, a documentary at DevCon, and after-movies highlighting Celo's role at these events to record eight videos throughout H2. We aim to drive growth, solidify partnerships, and support the community‚Äôs vision.

project.title: Celo Europe DAO
project.description:
Celo Europe DAO was established in 2023 to accelerate the Celo ecosystem in Europe by supporting mission-driven entrepreneurs and creators. Over the last months, we‚Äôve been focusing on increasing internal coordination between Celo Europe and the broader ecosystem and between Celo and the other regional DAOs. 

We aim to promote the adoption of Celo‚Äôs technology by building a robust network of developers, entrepreneurs, and enthusiasts dedicated to creating sustainable and impactful blockchain solutions in Europe. We've done this through community building, educational outreach, events, and content creation.

answers.question: Intro and socials of other team members or core contributors associated with the organisation?

answers.answer:
We propose to tackle the above identified problem by kickstarting with the following but not limited to:

Workshop and Seminars: Organize workshops in 10 cities in Canada training them about web3 in relation to Celo and also training participants on how to build using Celo blockchain infrastructure.
Tentative Canada Focus Area: Toronto, Saskatchewan, Calgary.

KPI & Deliverables:

Achieve an average of 70 - 110 participants per city.

Educate over 1,000 participants about web 3 and blockchain in relation to Celo.

Train over 1,000 participants on how to use DeFi applications builts on Celo

Build a vibrant community in each City

Onboard 200 - 400 traditional developers to Celo

Train 50 - 100 developers on how to build using Celo

Organize 3 regional hackathon

Launch 10 new and existing projects to Celo mainnet.

Hackathon programs: We will organize multiple hybrid hackathon programs focusing on climate neutral initiatives, DeFi, and developing products that address real-world problems using the Celo blockchain. These hackathons will provide developers with hands-on experience building with Celo through our workshop programs and offer existing projects the opportunity to integrate Celo stacks.
KPI & Deliverables:

Mandatory use of Celo sdk, Minipay SDK, and other Celo tools in the hackathon
Regular dev support & guidance for participants
Achieve a minimum of 50 participants per hackathon
Deploy 10 - 15 projects on Celo mainnet.
Provide continuous development support to participants post-hackathon
Interaction with Celo blockchain and developer toolkits
Events partnership & sponsorship: Represent Celo at major events happening in Canada and boast brand visibility by communicating Celo‚Äôs core values.
KPIs & Deliverables

Represent Celo at 5 major conferences across Canada
Establish strategic partnership with 10 organizations including, protocols, institutions and like-minded communities
Sponsor and participate in 3 seminars or events per quarter
Onboard a minimum of 100 attendees from these events to Celo‚Äôs ecosystem.
Curriculum & educational materials: Create curriculum on essential web3 concepts and guide about Celo, how to build Dapps, interaction with Celo apps, etc.
KPIs & Deliverables:

Create a comprehensive curriculum on web3 and Celo.
Engage at least 500 users with educational content within the first 6 months.
Develop a guide on how to use apps on Celo.
Educational material on potential impact of blockchain in Canada‚Äôs industries like Agric, healthcare, etc
Curriculum on how to get started with Celo
Educational material on to build on the blockchain in relation to Celo
Content creation Website & Socials: Launch an official website, social channel for Celo Canada and also create compelling video and articles.
KPIs & Deliverables

Produce and share 5-10 video content pieces about Celo per quarter.
Host weekly twitter spaces and AMAs
Launch an official Celo Canada Website for social media channels
Publish 10 articles on high traffic blogs about latest advancement in Celo

project.title: Celo Canada - regional hub
project.description:
Web3 adoption is currently very low in Canada, leaving significant untapped potential in the Canadian market that can benefit from Celo‚Äôs web3 solutions. 

Celo is a leading platform in the new digital economy, and it has potential to address various environmental and economic challenges in Canada thereby promoting financial inclusion and blockchain adoption.

The establishment of Celo Canada hub will provide visibility and foster innovation and growth of the Celo blockchain.

Objectives:

Community Engagement:

We want to create a vibrant community of developers, entrepreneurs, and users within Canada who are actively involved in Celo‚Äôs blockchain ecosystem. This will grow to become a perpetual group of blockchain enthusiasts that kickstarted their journey with the Celo network.

Spark Local Innovation:

Our mission is to encourage the creation of decentralized applications with the use Celo stacks that are specifically designed to meet the unique needs of people living in Canada, solve problems attributed to specific Provinces and needs of local businesses.

Enhance Financial Accessibility

Use Celo‚Äôs innovative mobile-first blockchain platform to make financial services more accessible to underserved communities across Canada, ensuring everyone has the opportunity to participate in the digital economy.

Environmental Sustainability

Promote the use of Celo‚Äôs carbon-neutral blockchain technology to develop solutions that are not only effective but also environmentally sustainable, aligning with Canada‚Äôs green initiatives and goals.

Motivation:

Lack of visibility: Celo has no presence in the Canada crypto/web3 ecosystem

Low blockchain adoption: The user base of web3 and blockchain technology in Canada is very low. Showcasing Celo to the large population in Canada will not only enhance Celo‚Äôs visibility but make Celo dominate the market as Canada‚Äôs native blockchain infrastructural provider.

High Cost of Remittances: Canadians and Immigrants finds it difficult and costly to make international financial transactions. Celo being a mobile-first web3 platform solves this problem with different defi applications built on Celo.

Overall, Canada is a developed country that has great potential and gaps that needs the solution of web3 service which Celo blockchain is capable of providing.

We propose to tackle the above identified problem by kickstarting with the following but not limited to:

Workshop and Seminars: 

Organize workshops in 10 cities in Canada training them about web3 in relation to Celo and also training participants on how to build using Celo blockchain infrastructure.
Tentative Canada Focus Area: Toronto, Saskatchewan, Calgary.

KPI & Deliverables:

Achieve an average of 70 - 110 participants per city.

Educate over 1,000 participants about web 3 and blockchain in relation to Celo.

Train over 1,000 participants on how to use DeFi applications builts on Celo

Build a vibrant community in each City

Onboard 200 - 400 traditional developers to Celo

Train 50 - 100 developers on how to build using Celo

Organize 3 regional hackathon

Launch 10 new and existing projects to Celo mainnet.

Hackathon programs: 

We will organize multiple hybrid hackathon programs focusing on climate neutral initiatives, DeFi, and developing products that address real-world problems using the Celo blockchain. These hackathons will provide developers with hands-on experience building with Celo through our workshop programs and offer existing projects the opportunity to integrate Celo stacks.

KPI & Deliverables:

Mandatory use of Celo sdk, Minipay SDK, and other Celo tools in the hackathon

Regular dev support & guidance for participants

Achieve a minimum of 50 participants per hackathon

Deploy 10 - 15 projects on Celo mainnet.

Provide continuous development support to participants post-hackathon

Interaction with Celo blockchain and developer toolkits

Events partnership & sponsorship: 

Represent Celo at major events happening in Canada and boast brand visibility by communicating Celo‚Äôs core values.

KPIs & Deliverables

Represent Celo at 5 major conferences across Canada

Establish strategic partnership with 10 organizations including, protocols, 
institutions and like-minded communities

Sponsor and participate in 3 seminars or events per quarter

Onboard a minimum of 100 attendees from these events to Celo‚Äôs ecosystem.

Curriculum & educational materials: 

Create curriculum on essential web3 concepts and guide about Celo, how to build Dapps, interaction with Celo apps, etc.

KPIs & Deliverables:

Create a comprehensive curriculum on web3 and Celo.

Engage at least 500 users with educational content within the first 6 months.

Develop a guide on how to use apps on Celo.

Educational material on potential impact of blockchain in Canada‚Äôs industries like Finance, supply chain, Agric, healthcare, etc

Curriculum on how to get started with Celo
Educational material on how to build on the blockchain in relation to Celo

Content creation Website & Socials: 

Launch an official website, social channel for Celo Canada and also create compelling video and articles.

KPIs & Deliverables

Achieve a minimum of 2 million engagements across social media channels.
Produce and share 5-10 video content 
pieces about Celo per quarter.
Host weekly twitter spaces and AMAs
Launch an official Celo Canada Website for social media channels
Publish 10 articles on high traffic blogs about latest advancement in Celo
Tentative Canada Province for H2 | 2024 : Toronto, Saskatchewan, Calgary.


Tractions & Team members:

Organized the first ever blockchain event in Saskatchewan, Canada 2.

Ambassador for the largest blockchain event in Canada - Blockchain Futuristic Conference 2

Organized and participated in 40+ hackathons based on web2 & web3 solutions. Some apps built are:
1.Dev Match - a decentralized to connect with your tech mate.
2.Shark Tank - a web based 3D online game.
3 Skaap - enables shopper to scan and pay for items.

Trained over 200+ developers online and in-person

Team Member is a lead at cyber security UofR and Google developer student club

Team:

Abdulkareem Oyeneye: 1 Lead
He is an accomplished Project and Program Manager with extensive experience in driving growth and engagement within the blockchain and decentralized technology sectors. Proven track record of onboarding thousands of users, organizing high-impact conferences, workshops, and hackathons, and fostering strong community relations at leading organizations like Near Protocol, Solana and Arbitrum Foundation.

Satyam Singh Developer relation
He is a full stack developer passionate about exploring web3 and Large Language Models (LLMs) and have hands-on experience with machine learning and decentralized technologies.

Bimpe O. Project manager
She is a climate-neutral advocate and a quality assurance professional with expertise in implementing Lean Six Sigma methods for process improvement and waste reduction. Her passion for empowering women in the web3 space has led her to run various educational initiatives and training programs, significantly facilitating the onboarding process for newcomers, especially women, into the web3 ecosystem.

metadata.title: Celo Canada - regional hub

The establishment of Celo Canada hub will provide visibility and foster innovation and growth of the Celo blockchain.
